For sake of completeness, in the current code, or in an older microversion after this idea is implemented, what would the result be when calling the DELETE on the URI described, with a cold migration?'}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2016-11-14 14:37:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 20:

@Chris, Thank you for your comment.
In cold migration case, the task state of VM instance never becomes 'MIGRATING'. So nova-api returns 400 error(HTTPBadRequest).

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/633c817de5a67e798d8610d0df1135e5a568fd8a/nova/compute/api.py#L3731"}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2016-11-14 15:18:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 20: Code-Review+2

This is parity with the live migration operation and I think we're in agreement that we should be able to do this. Still not happy with the grammar bits of this, but in the interest of moving forward I'm going to +2 this. Hopefully some follow-up can address those."}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2016-11-14 15:21:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6062, 'date': '2016-11-14 18:33:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2016-11-14 19:44:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 20: Code-Review-1

(7 comments)

Several comments inline.

I'm suspicious of how this would be integrated with hyper-v and os-win, I'd want to see the hyper-v subteam (claudiub/lpetrut) weigh in on that, but I wouldn't hold the spec up on it for now as I'm sure something could be implemented there, it's just not as trivial as described here probably.

I'm -1 because I think we have a UX problem where the server migrations that we return from the REST API today don't specify the type of migration:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/4058471132f06ae8b137f6a4a917e1b2b7382158/nova/api/openstack/compute/server_migrations.py#L32

So if I want to cancel a migration from the nova CLI and I'm listing migrations for a server, I don't know which is a cold or live migration. I guess I could infer that based on status - if I recently started a cold migration and was monitoring it, then I could check that status and assume it's the migration I want to cancel, but is that safe? What if I'm not the same admin that started the migration?

I also can't rely on getting the migration ID back from the REST API because the migration actions don't return it:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/4058471132f06ae8b137f6a4a917e1b2b7382158/nova/api/openstack/compute/migrate_server.py#L52

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/4058471132f06ae8b137f6a4a917e1b2b7382158/nova/api/openstack/compute/migrate_server.py#L71

So it seems we should make that migrations response a bit more detailed by including the type."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2016-11-14 19:51:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 20: -Code-Review

I might be over-thinking this. You can only be performing a single migration on a server at once, so either cold or live. And when listing migrations, you can only abort the running one, of which there are 0 or 1. And when you request to abort that migration, nova API figures out the type of migration based on the migration record, so it knows which method to call. So we probably don't need type after all."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2016-11-14 19:53:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:

(5 comments)

Soft -1 on missing some considerations for tracking this with an instance action, and making sure to cleanup allocations in placement, which usually turns out to be an afterthought and results in bugs.

I don't think we can use Tempest for testing, we'd use functional tests.

I'm also not sure how each virt driver is going to implement this, or how that's been considered, but I know it's come up in the past. Any notes on discussions with the virt driver maintainers would be useful."}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2017-10-19 13:21:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 65: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

Some comments about the notification impact.
Cheers,
gibi'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2017-10-19 13:25:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 65:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2017-10-19 13:26:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 65:

As a second thought I accept not to block this due to my notification comments but handle the notification impact separately, later.

(Keeping the -1 until somebody states that there will be no notification impact)

Cheers,
gibi'}, {'account_id': 7166, 'date': '2017-10-19 13:27:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 65: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

Honestly, a very small -1 for just making sure you explain what would be the needed modifications for virt drivers.'}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2017-10-19 13:50:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 65:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2017-10-19 21:12:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 67: Code-Review+1

In general, this looks fine to me.

As a driver owner:

PowerVM supports cold migration only with shared disk (we have a couple of shared ephemeral disk implementations, so that doesn't just mean volume-based) and our strategic direction is such that we're not likely to add localdisk copy support.  So I doubt PowerVM users would need/want this feature, unless there's some other reason for the migration to hang.  That being the case, we probably wouldn't bother implementing it."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2017-10-19 21:36:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 67: -Code-Review

Oh, so my previous comment was based on the assumption that a cold migration would take a long time because we're copying localdisk bits over the wire.  That's the definite impression I gleaned from reading the spec.  If it's also supposed to be about "sometimes stuff hangs", that's different, and PowerVM might care.  But that should be made clear in the spec.'}, {'account_id': 3189, 'date': '2017-10-19 22:20:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 67:

(3 comments)

A few comments about the details but in general I'm positive on the idea. The more control we have over long running operations the better."}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2017-12-26 06:17:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 68.'}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2017-12-26 06:20:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 69: Published edit on patch set 68.'}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2017-12-26 06:20:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 69:

commit_message:
Abort Cold Migration

Provide a way to cancel a cold migration
in the state of copying ephemeral disks.

APIImpact
Change-Id: I40c48ebec4dc6b15ca472bee4bf1c661c76bdb09
blueprint abort-cold-migration

[{'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2018-10-19 09:19:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-10-19 15:30:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2018-10-22 16:38:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

If you cherry-picked this from master, why isn't that mentioned in the commit msg?"}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2018-10-22 16:38:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2018-10-23 00:47:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2018-10-23 00:51:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Thanks rloo for the review, updated. I had seen such commit message, but I don't know if it's automatically generated, looks like it's manually appended. If you know some high-tech way, please let me know :)"}, {'account_id': 15519, 'date': '2018-10-23 07:55:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-10-23 12:37:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2018-10-23 13:07:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

@Kaifeng. Thx! If you use the 'Cherry Pick' button in the UI, it'll add the cherry pick stuff to the commit.

I thought if you did a 'git cherry-pick' it would also add that info to the commit. It has been awhile since I've done one, don't know if something has changed.

I think that's why I was surprised not to see that info."}, {'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2018-10-24 00:52:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> @Kaifeng. Thx! If you use the 'Cherry Pick' button in the UI, it'll
 > add the cherry pick stuff to the commit.
 > 
 > I thought if you did a 'git cherry-pick' it would also add that
 > info to the commit. It has been awhile since I've done one, don't
 > know if something has changed.
 > 
 > I think that's why I was surprised not to see that info.

@loo: actually I did it in the UI, seemed not working as expected, will try to do a local cherry pick next time, thanks for the info!"}]

commit_message:
Fix a LOG.warning which didn't work properly

Found when checking ci logs here:

http://logs.openstack.org/41/587041/3/check/ironic-inspector-tempest-dsvm-discovery/7912a3a/logs/screen-ironic-inspector.txt.gz#_Oct_17_16_44_39_477744

It's supposed to be printing missing arguments when constructing
an http client.

The http client is supposed to be removed ?soon?, so if the fix is
not required, please let me know.

Change-Id: I2bad387afa2ede56da7164a7bc9a5ac461e78d9c
(cherry picked from commit a28ccb9ef8a55f96923ba4a3af12b73a91b2e448)

commit_message:
Fix QuotasNegativeTest to use non dynamic credentials

The tests with enabled force_tenant_isolation option always use dynamic
credentials. Made changes to QuotasNegativeTest to run test in the new
project.

Change-Id: I62ce52fda632eaa27f8145ce0cead0b13ff8587a
Closes-Bug: #1789938

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-23 09:01:18.000000000', 'message': 'Make port binding attempt after agent is revived

In some cases it may happen that port is "binding_failed"
because L2 agent running on destination host was down but
this is "temporary" issue.
It is like that for example in case when using L3 HA and when
master and backup network nodes were e.g. rebooted.
L3 agent might start running before L2 agent on host in such case
and if it's new master node, router ports will have "binding_failed"
state.

When agent sends heartbeat and is getting back to live,
ML2 plugin will try to bind all ports with "binding_failed"
from this host.

Change-Id: I3bedb7c22312884cc28aa78aa0f8fbe418f97090
Closes-Bug: #1794809
(cherry picked from commit f787f12aa3441ecffef55f261c4d87dbb12ca6cf)
'}]
commit_message:
Make port binding attempt after agent is revived

In some cases it may happen that port is "binding_failed"
because L2 agent running on destination host was down but
this is "temporary" issue.
It is like that for example in case when using L3 HA and when
master and backup network nodes were e.g. rebooted.
L3 agent might start running before L2 agent on host in such case
and if it's new master node, router ports will have "binding_failed"
state.

When agent sends heartbeat and is getting back to live,
ML2 plugin will try to bind all ports with "binding_failed"
from this host.

Change-Id: I3bedb7c22312884cc28aa78aa0f8fbe418f97090
Closes-Bug: #1794809
(cherry picked from commit f787f12aa3441ecffef55f261c4d87dbb12ca6cf)

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because of that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I5aea94cce51f71d98135ef94bab7445de59fa3a5

commit_message:
Dynamically find releases for move-implemented-specs

This adds a shallow directory walk to find the available releases for
moving implemented specs, so we don't have to update the script per
release to add a release choice.

Change-Id: I80ea14f07da9361b26645d997de0fcbe4ba19afc

Ironic has evolved and a few items were no longer correct
in the contributed scripts for use with ironic.

commented out.

commit_message:
Provide a region to the K8S Fedora Atomic config

Kubernetes should initialize its Global configuration for the OpenStack
provider with the region specified in the Heat stack.
This will allow user to create Magnum Kubernetes clusters in
multiregional OpenStack installation with different public endpoint for
services.

Task: 22576
Story: 2002728
Change-Id: I66820369b889e16445cad7a48cd0f458aae1c41f
(cherry picked from commit a28e5609f991ce32255f7badcad2514ca8e66ab8)

commit_message:
Install python-virtualenv if not available

This role is failing as it's attempting to to pip
install pip in the geneal env, but pip is not available
on some platforms.
This review does the install in a venv.

Change-Id: Ie7b3215b6997b5c6315ac29691a8798e6636004f

commit_message:
Fix dvr ha router gateway goes wrong host

During L3 agent restart, the dvr ha router gateway port
binding host may change because the multiple ha router
scheduled hosts.

After this patch, we return the 'master' ha binding host
directly during the gateway port create. And do not let
the original 'master' (current is backup) host override
the gateway port binding host.

Closes-Bug: #1793529
Change-Id: Icb2112c7f0bd42c4f4b1cf32d6b83b6d97f85ef7

[{'created': '2018-09-08 08:46:03.000000000', 'message': "Add prometheus-monitoring namespace

When using 'prometheus_monitoring=true' in the label option,
'kube-enable-monitoring.service' in the master node has stuck in
'Wait for Grafana pod and then inject data source'.
It caused the 'prometheus-monitoring' namespace doesn't exist,
so scripts don't create pods about Prometheus and Grafana.

To fix the error, I added codes in 'magnum/drivers/common/templates/
kubernetes/fragments/enable-prometheus-monitoring.sh' to make
'prometheus-monitoring' namespace.

We could put codes in a new file like 'magnum/magnum/drivers/
k8s_coreos_v1/templates/fragments/create-kube-namespace.yaml', but we
check the parameter of 'prometheus_monitoring' is true in the upper
line so I think the position of codes is ok.

Change-Id: I23395b41919c6f39cfcc2b4480bcd4b040cae031
Task: 26347
Story: 2003697

commit_message:
Add prometheus-monitoring namespace

When using 'prometheus_monitoring=true' in the label option,
'kube-enable-monitoring.service' in the master node has stuck in
'Wait for Grafana pod and then inject data source'.
It caused the 'prometheus-monitoring' namespace doesn't exist,
so scripts don't create pods about Prometheus and Grafana.

To fix the error, I added codes in 'magnum/drivers/common/templates/
kubernetes/fragments/enable-prometheus-monitoring.sh' to make
'prometheus-monitoring' namespace.

We could put codes in a new file like 'magnum/magnum/drivers/
k8s_coreos_v1/templates/fragments/create-kube-namespace.yaml',
but I think it's ok.

Change-Id: I23395b41919c6f39cfcc2b4480bcd4b040cae031
Task: 26347
Story: 2003697

commit_message:
Use supplied HELM variable for dep up in Makefile

Updates the helm dep up command to use the $(HELM) variable instead of
the locally istalled helm for the host machine. This bring this line of
code in alignment with the other uses of helm in the same Makefile.

Change-Id: I91bfdceedd3bac0ac49daf5b9410c05e0e840168

commit_message:
cronjob-checkPGs failure fix

Added role and rolebindings to fix permissions.
Added volumes definitions for ceph-bin, ceph-etc
and ceph-client-adminkeyring
serviceaccount and node selectors

Implements: Bug 1797589
Closes-Bug: #1797589
Change-Id: Ib0e77e088c6aa82e441aba72bebc4b258deb88c4

@Matt @Jay Thanks for your advices. Maybe using placement API will satisfy my demands. I will dig and test more."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-10-23 20:20:04.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

There have been no updates on this in several months and it would need to be reproposed for stein anyway. If all this is asking for is getting the allocation ratios out of the API, that is available via the placement API now:

https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/placement/?expanded=list-resource-provider-inventories-detail#list-resource-provider-inventories

https://docs.openstack.org/osc-placement/latest/cli/index.html#resource-provider-inventory-list

If this is more about how the allocation ratios are *set* then you are probably more interested in these related specs:

https://review.openstack.org/552105

https://review.openstack.org/544683

Therefore I'm going to abandon this spec."}]

commit_message:
Add ram/cpu/disk allocation ratio to Hypervisor show

Currently, the ``GET /os-hypervisors/detail`` and
``GET /os-hypervisors/{hypervisor_id}`` API does not get
ram_allocation_ratio, cpu_allocation_ratio and
disk_allocation_ratio.
The user sets the allocation ratio by using the
configuration, but they can not see through Nova API.

APIImpact

Spec for blueprint: add-ratio-to-hypervisor-show

Change-Id: Iaa92f61bc21b338aa935ad272c3758ace3f99eb4

commit_message:
Fix the missing region name information for Keystone client

When using several regions, Rally's Keystone client does not use
the region endpoint specified in the context. So we added
the region name used in credentials to be able to connect
to the correct region endpoint

Change-Id: I441aee8ffb82963396d40405ea740276edc7dfe5
Co-Authored-By: rcherrueau <Ronan-Alexandre.Cherrueau@inria.fr>

commit_message:
scripts: sources-branch-updater: Make regexp for master branch stricter

The regexp does not work properly when the upstream repo has many
branches named 'master' such as ceph-ansible

0fa368a7441528457b7bcb99f8a860d7987b9ba6 refs/heads/guits-update_req_master
79bd06ad28d8a078bd95923b230eb8d5b66095b2 refs/heads/master

which breaks the script when bumping SHAs. As such, lets make it
stricter by simply matching /master$ instead.

Change-Id: I24526a358d7a21821f8c9789ba199863981f8d7b
(cherry picked from commit a9c72408bef1508fe26f515db02e347892ed8618)

[{'created': '2018-10-08 10:08:44.000000000', 'message': "Make master node schedulable with taints

--register-with-taints take no effect when --register-schedulable=false
configured. It's better to drop --register-schedulable and
leave --register-with-taints to make master schedulable

add --pod-infra-container-image=CONTAINER_INFRA_PREFIX
for kubelet on master nodes.

Change-Id: Ia2ce59841d823ba02a65224088e5af1a8c9610b1
"}]
commit_message:
Make master node schedulable with taints

--register-with-taints take no effect when --register-schedulable=false
configured. It's better to drop --register-schedulable and
leave --register-with-taints to make master schedulable

add --pod-infra-container-image=CONTAINER_INFRA_PREFIX
for kubelet on master nodes.

Change-Id: Ia2ce59841d823ba02a65224088e5af1a8c9610b1

[{'created': '2018-10-22 16:29:00.000000000', 'message': 'Switch nodepool builders to zk cluster

Switch over the nodepool builders to our newer zk cluster from the old
single node zk cluster. We will stop building images that the launchers
can see before the launchers move, but this lets us preseed the new
cluster with up to date image data.

Once the images are built with records in the new zk cluster we can
switch over the zuul scheduler and the launchers to this newer cluster.

Change-Id: I95ca326095decc03cf279383fa48dbdfc56ed8c8
'}]
commit_message:
Switch nodepool builders to zk cluster

Switch over the nodepool builders to our newer zk cluster from the old
single node zk cluster. We will stop building images that the launchers
can see before the launchers move, but this lets us preseed the new
cluster with up to date image data.

Once the images are built with records in the new zk cluster we can
switch over the zuul scheduler and the launchers to this newer cluster.

Change-Id: I95ca326095decc03cf279383fa48dbdfc56ed8c8

commit_message:
Add trove-status upgrade check command framework

This adds basic framework for trove-status upgrade
check commands. For now it has only "check_placeholder"
check implemented.
Real checks can be added to this tool in the future.

Change-Id: Idfeab4c06cba6f841c17ab6e255a29e8707bfa55
Story: 2003657
Task: 26162

The previous fix for Bug #1798066 assumed that b64 decoding a
PEM certificate would through an exception. This is not true as

"}, {'created': '2018-10-23 15:27:14.000000000', 'message': "Correct check for b64 encoding

The previous fix for Bug #1798066 assumed that b64 decoding a
PEM certificate would throw an exception. This is not true as
PEM certs are b64 encoded. This fix explicitly checks for the
'BEGIN CERTIFICATE' string to check if the supplied ssl_ca
value is encoded or not.

Change-Id: I4fbdb0c2f768f2641b8fb3b43a4f94f2748484c0
"}]
commit_message:
Correct check for b64 encoding

The previous fix for Bug #1798066 assumed that b64 decoding a
PEM certificate would throw an exception. This is not true as
PEM certs are b64 encoded. This fix explicitly checks for the
'BEGIN CERTIFICATE' string to check if the supplied ssl_ca
value is encoded or not.

Change-Id: I4fbdb0c2f768f2641b8fb3b43a4f94f2748484c0

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC

Dominic, for reference, here is the placement request filter spec:

Best,

-jay"}, {'account_id': 28168, 'date': '2018-04-30 09:12:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-04-30 13:29:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-06-05 20:48:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-06-05 20:51:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-10-23 18:36:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

No updates on this since Rocky after several months. In Rocky we landed features to allow having pre-request placement allocation candidate filtering and mirroring compute host aggregates to placement. If you plan on pursuing this change, please restore and re-proposed for stein and update with the latest information based on what's now available since rocky. Note that we also have the concept of shared storage providers in placement but there are known issues with those not being supported yet in nova:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1784020

But this proposal could possibly leverage shared storage providers, i.e. during a resize, if the disk provided to a server is coming from a shared storage provider, we should only select target hosts that are in an aggregate with the same shared storage provider and then we can avoid the ssh routines in the compute service."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-10-23 18:37:00.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Adds resize on shared storage without ssh keys

Resizing an instance on KVM currently requires passwordless ssh access
between all compute nodes. This is not necessarily needed for resizing
an instance where the underlying storage is shared. This spec therefore
addresses a solution to avoid having a single ssh key deployed on all
compute nodes which could be a security risk or a company policy issue.

Change-Id: Ifc95c5d1494a44eb42355556051628b2ef36fbcd
Implements: blueprint resize-on-shared-storage-without-ssh-keys

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-10 23:17:56.000000000', 'message': 'Add history behind nullable project_id and user_id

In the original spec review, there was confusion as to where the new
nullability of project_id and user_id came from.  This change adds words
explaining the history.

Change-Id: I2062a2f3709e62b3e601db0eb5e408b67c330c48
'}]
commit_message:
Add history behind nullable project_id and user_id

In the original spec review, there was confusion as to where the new
nullability of project_id and user_id came from.  This change adds words
explaining the history.

Change-Id: I2062a2f3709e62b3e601db0eb5e408b67c330c48

commit_message:
[gate] allow pip caching

The pip cache is useful for repeat operations and doesn't seem to have
any real downsides.

Change-Id: Iadb21a118f8d725911a9baa6a9264b8644012af9

commit_message:
[gate] Put nfs-provisioner in it's own namespace (docker-registry)

Use the 'docker-nfs' namespace to back the docker registry.  This
means we can delete the registry namespace without causing IO lockups.

Change-Id: I1706dd96653598dcfbb81904fde8c0bf92294b06

Having storage (backend) components in their own namespace means we

Change-Id: Ie489709b08929f25cf0e626a8541620a06506b8b
"}]
commit_message:
[gate] Put nfs-provisioner in it's own namespace

Having storage (backend) components in their own namespace means we
can delete the namespaces containing the openstack without causing
system hangs which occur when storage is remove whilst in use.

Change-Id: Ie489709b08929f25cf0e626a8541620a06506b8b

commit_message:
MNAIO: Add legacy os-infra_hosts group back

In https://review.openstack.org/611582 we removed
the legacy group as it has been deprecated since
Newton, however it appears to still be used by some
downstream tests, so we add it back, but make it
only get implemented if the associated services
are enabled.

Change-Id: I477a46d606d75d44a1ecd5bcfcb29c8308c65245

commit_message:
Set container_name as host_var in test inventory

The connection plugin no longer falls back on using the
inventory_hostname as the container_name. Set container_name as a host
var for each container in the test inventory.

In this role's case there are no containers, so I've just removed
the group_var so that the test setup is uniform with other roles
which do use containers.

Change-Id: If491e94c5d66f7e236bd344980b3d63ab22761d5

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-10 15:03:00.000000000', 'message': 'Prometheus kubelet.rules change

kube_node_status_ready and up metrics are obsolete to check the kubernetes node condition. When a kubelet is down that means node itself in NotReady state. With 1.3.1 kube-state-metrics exporter kube_node_info metric provides the status value of the kubelet (essentially node). https://github.com/kubernetes/kube-state-metrics/blob/master/Documentation/node-metrics.md

K8SKubeletDown is no more neeeded since K8SNodeNotReady resemsbles the same status. Replaced the kube_node_status_ready with kube_node_info and changed the 1h to 1m and increased the severity to "critical". Also removed the K8SKubeletDown definitions which are not required anymore.

commit_message:
Prometheus kubelet.rules change

kube_node_status_ready and up metrics are obsolete to check the kubernetes
node condition. When a kubelet is down that means node itself in NotReady
state. With 1.3.1 kube-state-metrics exporter kube_node_status_condition
metric provides the status value of the kubelet (essentially node).
https://github.com/kubernetes/kube-state-metrics/blob/master/Documentation
/node-metrics.md

kube_node_status_condition includes condition=Ready and status as true,
flase and unknown. When a kubelet is stopped the status will be unknown
since the kubelet itself will unable to talk to API. In other cases it
will be false. When the node is registered and available it will be set to
true.

Replaced the kube_node_status_ready with kube_node_status_condition and
changed the 1h to 1m and increased the severity to "critical". Also
modified the K8SKubeletDown definitions with 1m and critical sevrity

Implements: Bug 1797133
Closes-Bug: #1797133
Change-Id: I025adb13c9d8642a218dfda1ff30f1577fa8c826
Signed-off-by: Kranthi Kiran Guttikonda <kranthi.guttikonda@b-yond.com>

The mount state could be volitile making it so the "restart-or-reload"
option fails to execute. If this happens the task will now be rescued
and the mount state will be attempted using the regular systemd
module.

Change-Id: I86fc03ad7c72fa4cfdfc598f552f936dda653926
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add mount state rescue block

The mount state could be volitile making it so the "restart-or-reload"
option fails to execute. If this happens the task will now be rescued
and the mount state will be attempted using the regular systemd
module.

Change-Id: I86fc03ad7c72fa4cfdfc598f552f936dda653926
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Support shared/dedicated vCPUs in one instance

This feature enables instances that have vCPUs that are pinned to specific
pCPUs and vCPUs that are not pinned to specific pCPUs. We introduce
``hw:shared_vcpus`` as an additional option of ``hw:cpu-policy=dedicated``
in the flavor extra spec.

Co-Authored-By: dineshbhor <dinesh.bhor@nttdata.com>
Blueprint: mixed-cpu-policy-instance
Change-Id: I3004d19e26bc949eb84ac50c65f6b0aa8ee1150a

[{'created': '2018-10-17 21:57:08.000000000', 'message': 'Install pip packages during requirements build

Install packages from PIP_PACKAGES before wheel build to be able
to limit dependencies specified in "setup_requires" of packages
listed in upper-constraints.txt, that pip has not way to control.
This is intended to work around https://github.com/lxc/pylxd/issues/308
or similar issues.

commit_message:
Install pip packages during requirements build

Install packages from PIP_PACKAGES before wheel build to be able
to limit dependencies specified in "setup_requires" of packages
listed in upper-constraints.txt, that pip has no way to control.
This is intended to work around https://github.com/lxc/pylxd/issues/308
or similar issues.

Change-Id: I36bd4347727b4c7f4beea2cdba6674445fbb4ca4

commit_message:
Handle in-tree tempest plugins

A recent patch[1] enabled upper-constraints checking for tempest plugins.
This patch causes failures for some scenarios with in-tree tempest plugins
because pip does not allow applying constraints to local paths. The resulting
error is "installation from path or url cannot be constrained to a version".

This patch handles local paths and URLs without checking upper constraints
but maintains the functionality for packages by name.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/560946
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/39/541039/13/check/octavia-v1-dsvm-scenario/ \
    c801e2b/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-04-17_22_09_54_936113

Change-Id: I445e218ff6a7d739e5f144833853726deaaa1a3a

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 6476, 'date': '2018-10-23 08:57:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2018-10-23 09:15:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(7 comments)

Hello Simeon and thanks for your contribution!

I've added some remarks that could need some fixing other than that this seems like a solid contribution.

Please include a release note that indicates to the consumers of this Puppet module that those parameters are now available. OpenStack is using Reno [1] for release notes.

It's super simple simply do something along the lines ``reno new swift-max-containers-per-account`` and it will output a path to a new file in $module_root/releasenotes/notes folder and simply exit the ``features`` section. See this example [2].

If you have any questions dont hesitate to shout at us in #puppet-openstack on Freenode.

Best regards

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/reno/latest/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/602277/5/releasenotes/notes/password-hash-algo-884cb38f8edecb6b.yaml"}, {'account_id': 29349, 'date': '2018-10-23 09:44:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Gnocchi depends on pycradox, which currently has an upper limit for

commit_message:
Set an upper pin for Cython to please gnocchi

Gnocchi depends on pycradox, which currently has an upper limit for
its dependency Cython. As Cython is not present in upper-constraints
there is nothing to stop the repo build from using the new one, and
the gnocchi venv build fails.

Change-Id: Ib85d545a8879b82be8d492809f9764fa0efb78e6
(cherry picked from commit 1fd9fdc6d8bc82422211f68a99f5b153b2446d19)

commit_message:
Add default for openrc_os_domain_name and update example

There is currently no default value for openrc_os_domain_name,
so we add one, and we update the example to remove the unnecessary
overrides.

commit_message:
Make horizon DB management cron task idempotent

Use a seed in the glance cache management cron task's random
filter so that each host's results are idempotent when re-running.
This prevents the constant changing of the crontab whenever the
playbook is run.

Change-Id: I441d5d30e06f24a1149926f9068e7e4838b3a723

commit_message:
Adding 'date' for trust_flush

This patch adds functionality to purge
expired and soft-deleted trusts older
than the given date.

Change-Id: I0bd47e57f8650182e38b4f70e04cb53338fce474
Related-Bug: #1473292

Change-Id: Ib8e7b67b9400fb983aecaae95f50bb3ec35d4c26
'}]
commit_message:
Fix issues with and enable Python 3 job

Python 3 disallows implicit relative imports.

When skip_tags is provided as a single string, it will need to be cast
to an array to avoid being treated as a list of characters when compared
to task.tags.

Change-Id: Ib8e7b67b9400fb983aecaae95f50bb3ec35d4c26

commit_message:
Add support for subnet assignment when creating servers

When there are multiple subnets on a network, currently it
is impossible to pass a subnet parameter to the API request
and boot an instance on a specific subnet of that network.
This blueprint aims to modify the create server API to accept
``subnet_id`` as an additional parameter of ``networks`` field
and make booting on a specific subnet of a given network possible.

APIImpact
DocImpact

Change-Id: I0d1c521b2974dc57072ae0d972e33ca677d2a462

commit_message:
Make onboot parameter for ifcfg configuration configurable

Currently the onboot parameter is hardcoded to YES, some
configurations need to disable it.

Change-Id: I139e8e9b2c8ff087ff1bf8daa8c902c4c0833d89
Close-Bug: 1705228

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-17 11:37:56.000000000', 'message': 'In DevStack install Redis client library via pip, not as system package

System package name depends on Python version, while pip library name
is uniform for both py2 and py3.

Change-Id: I7ba7db61d2b07af4b880393bc0463d733f34f8cf
'}]
commit_message:
In DevStack install Redis client library via pip, not as system package

System package name depends on Python version, while pip library name
is uniform for both py2 and py3.

Change-Id: I7ba7db61d2b07af4b880393bc0463d733f34f8cf

Would be nice to document that osprofiler supports as trace ids not only uuid strings, but also integers and those integers are not changed when reported to Jaeger. May be a subject for a separate patch.'}, {'account_id': 5950, 'date': '2018-10-16 16:15:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

BTW, should we extend the rule and preserve any 16-characters hexadecimal string?'}, {'account_id': 23630, 'date': '2018-10-16 16:22:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> BTW, should we extend the rule and preserve any 16-characters
 > hexadecimal string?

Hmm, I think that we should keep 16-characters string (64-bit) and uuid4 (128-bit) only. Any other number should be convert to one of these two.'}, {'account_id': 5950, 'date': '2018-10-17 08:56:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: -Code-Review

> > BTW, should we extend the rule and preserve any 16-characters
 > > hexadecimal string?
 > 
 > Hmm, I think that we should keep 16-characters string (64-bit) and
 > uuid4 (128-bit) only. Any other number should be convert to one of
 > these two.

Agree. 

Shoham, would it be simpler to have 16-character hex strings instead of integers? (assuming that trace-id is propagated from outside in Jagger-compatible form)'}, {'account_id': 20354, 'date': '2018-10-17 12:33:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Shoham, would it be simpler to have 16-character hex strings instead of integers?

It's not simpler, since Jaeger produces integers to pass on to the next services.
Converting those integers to 16-bit strings, is as easy as converting them to uuids.
Both conversion mean that Jaeger clients cannot be used as-is, and each service must convert Jaeger's UUIDs before sending them to the osprofiler service."}, {'account_id': 20354, 'date': '2018-10-17 12:39:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

BTW, I realized that this change should come with another complementary change.
If my non-osprofiler service uses novaclient to send requests to nova, currently novaclient gets the current trace/span IDs, via osprofiler, from osprofiler's profiler object from the TLS memory.
If we want non-osprofiler services to work seemlessly with osprofiler services, we need to make novaclient being able to get the trace-id and span-id, not only from osprofiler's profiler, since that is not configured in the non-osprofiler service, but also from other resources. Such resources may be jaeger-client's current trace/span IDs.

But as I said, this is independent of this current change."}, {'account_id': 5950, 'date': '2018-10-18 08:56:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

> It's not simpler, since Jaeger produces integers to pass on to the
 > next services.
 > Converting those integers to 16-bit strings, is as easy as
 > converting them to uuids.
 > Both conversion mean that Jaeger clients cannot be used as-is, and
 > each service must convert Jaeger's UUIDs before sending them to the
 > osprofiler service.

Ok. I got it :)"}, {'account_id': 5950, 'date': '2018-10-18 09:15:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> BTW, I realized that this change should come with another
 > complementary change.
 > If my non-osprofiler service uses novaclient to send requests to
 > nova, currently novaclient gets the current trace/span IDs, via
 > osprofiler, from osprofiler's profiler object from the TLS memory.
 > If we want non-osprofiler services to work seemlessly with
 > osprofiler services, we need to make novaclient being able to get
 > the trace-id and span-id, not only from osprofiler's profiler,
 > since that is not configured in the non-osprofiler service, but
 > also from other resources. Such resources may be jaeger-client's
 > current trace/span IDs.
 > 
 > But as I said, this is independent of this current change.

It's a good use case of integration - could you please file a bug in LP, so we do not forget about it? 

Basically osprofiler can be extended to extract tracing context from Jaeger's HTTP headers, similar to how WSGI middleware does now: https://github.com/openstack/osprofiler/blob/master/osprofiler/web.py

The alternative option would be to make the transformation in Jaeger codec (https://github.com/jaegertracing/jaeger-client-python/blob/master/jaeger_client/codecs.py) But since Jaeger is far more popular then osporfiler, it is osprofiler that should adapt :)"}, {'account_id': 20354, 'date': '2018-10-18 10:34:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I've reported 1798565.
Notice that HTTP REST headers is not enough, since the IDs can be configured in other places, like RPC, or even a request that was initiated by the service (e.g. a cron job), and not even received from outside."}, {'account_id': 5950, 'date': '2018-10-18 11:31:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> I've reported 1798565.

Thanks!

 > Notice that HTTP REST headers is not enough, since the IDs can be
 > configured in other places, like RPC, or even a request that was
 > initiated by the service (e.g. a cron job), and not even received
 > from outside.

Agree. I thought about HTTP first, because it corresponds to external API of OpenStack. Of course other transports are important too, at least I can imagine a custom Neutron plugin communicating via RPC with Neutron API."}, {'account_id': 23630, 'date': '2018-10-23 14:54:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Thank Shoham, thank Ilya.

I will merge this.'}]

When shortening span-ids, check if they're already short

If you're given an int, there's nothing to do, just return it

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-23 12:29:20.000000000', 'message': 'Make new-style single endpoint version discovery actually work for ironic

For (unclear) historical reasons the root single version endpoint also
contains "id" and "links" fields. This makes the current workaround
for old-style endpoints take priority over the correct algorithm.
This change reorders the code, so that if "version" is present, it
always take priority over the workaround.

The unit tests are updated to be closer to real output from ironic.

Change-Id: I743b954c6c5b2f986c213acb6ec6af7e08c9f5f8
'}]
commit_message:
Make new-style single endpoint version discovery actually work for ironic

For (unclear) historical reasons the root single version endpoint also
contains "id" and "links" fields. This makes the current workaround
for old-style endpoints take priority over the correct algorithm.
This change reorders the code, so that if "version" is present, it
always take priority over the workaround.

The unit tests are updated to be closer to real output from ironic.

Change-Id: I743b954c6c5b2f986c213acb6ec6af7e08c9f5f8

commit_message:
Make glance cache management cron task idempotent

Use a seed in the glance cache management cron task's random
filter so that each host's results are idempotent when re-running.
This prevents the constant changing of the crontab whenever the
playbook is run.

Change-Id: Ia14e867347aeadc6c55cef49f9f2ae0e6f86412f

commit_message:
Remove deprecated rabbit params in guestagent

This revemos the deprecated options rabbit_host,
rabbit_hosts and rabbit_port params in the
trove::guestagent class.

Changes the guestagent config file to use the
transport_url instead of the rabbit options. [1]

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/609981/

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-18 08:37:51.000000000', 'message': "Switch the charm to support py3

Some major changes:
* the charm has been rebased (from a Python perspective) to be rooted in
  the charm directory.  This is a single root.
* Imports have been changed so that the don't add lots of imports to the
  namespace of the module doing the import.
* The code that used to run at module import time has been made lazy
  such that it only has to run if the relevant functions are called.
  This includes restart_on_change parameters, the harden function and
  the parameters to the guard_map.  Appropriate changes will be
  submitted to charm-helpers.
* Several tests had to be re-written as (incorrect) mocking meant that
  text fixtures didn't actually match what the code was doing.  Thus,
  the tests were meaningless.
* This has had a net positive impact on the unit tests wrt to importing
  modules and mocking.

Change-Id: Id07d9d1caaa9b29453a63c2e49ba831071e9457f

Change-Id: Id07d9d1caaa9b29453a63c2e49ba831071e9457f

commit_message:
Switch the charm to support py3

Some major changes:
* the charm has been rebased (from a Python perspective) to be rooted in
  the charm directory.  This is a single root.
* Imports have been changed so that the don't add lots of imports to the
  namespace of the module doing the import.
* The code that used to run at module import time has been made lazy
  such that it only has to run if the relevant functions are called.
  This includes restart_on_change parameters, the harden function and
  the parameters to the guard_map.  Appropriate changes will be
  submitted to charm-helpers.
* Several tests had to be re-written as (incorrect) mocking meant that
  text fixtures didn't actually match what the code was doing.  Thus,
  the tests were meaningless.
* This has had a net positive impact on the unit tests wrt to importing
  modules and mocking.

Change-Id: Id07d9d1caaa9b29453a63c2e49ba831071e9457f

commit_message:
Update Ansible to 2.5.10

With the 2.5.10 release of Ansible, the mysql modules no
longer rely on MySQLdb and therefore no longer need the
mysql-python library - it all uses pymysql instead which
is pure python and python3 capable.

Change-Id: Ie05a1bbd4abd62527b373de54bf6673a5aba8e50

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-29 15:03:04.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I663739e2be72e32101764cbccc9713f1f9ba303a
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-10-23 11:52:04.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I663739e2be72e32101764cbccc9713f1f9ba303a
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I663739e2be72e32101764cbccc9713f1f9ba303a
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Add framework for sahara-status upgrade check

This commit adds the functionality of sahara-status CLI for performing
upgrade checks as part of the Stein cycle upgrade-checkers goal.
It only includes a sample check which must be replaced by real checks in
future.

Change-Id: Idcb8d9eaf689800812cf6087e9c5937058c89ea6
Story: 2003657
Task: 26152

commit_message:
Build OpenSUSE Leap 15 by default

This includes the building of OpenSUSE Leap 15 in checks/gates.

As the build of each project requires the building of the
requirements first, added to the fact that a new distro is added
into the jobs, this extends the timeout for the base job beyond
the maximum time for requirements, so that all the projects
(excluding requirements) have more time to complete.

Change-Id: I73b055b3942a6d80b8474544a9d65df0b3005e15

commit_message:
Fix unit tests after charms.openstack update

A recent commit to charms.openstack (78ce162e) added support for
using Endpoint based interfaces rather than RelationBase based
ones.  Update unit test to work with this change.

Add ``.stestr`` to ``.gitignore``

Change-Id: I5fc52738c1c7e918bd9213ef4714733d4e7dd934

commit_message:
policy: allow read of metadata for secret backend

Update policy for secrets backends to allow the metadata about
the backend to be read by remote clients.

This allows the KV store type to be determined.

Change-Id: Iea5d154401ff34e410f5bf5ab6412fe8f8e260b0

subject: Fix parameters in run-tempest role
messages:
[{'account_id': 5950, 'date': '2018-10-22 13:57:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-10-23 09:26:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5950, 'date': '2018-10-23 16:13:48.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

The solution is to use `all` tox environment instead of `full`'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-22 13:57:20.000000000', 'message': 'Fix parameters in run-tempest role

Readme of run-tempest job declares variable `tempest_test_regex`
to be a regular expression used to select the tests. But in
order to work this variable needs to be passed to tox with
--regex keyword. Otherwise it is passed as positional parameter
leading to error: "tempest run: error: unrecognized arguments" [1]

The similar issue is with `tempest_test_blacklist`, which is declared
as a blacklist file to skip tests that are not needed, so should be
passed with --blacklist-file parameter.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/59/609959/2/check/tempest-full-profiler-enabled/3054075/ara-report/result/1e906e1a-aa43-42a0-b5fa-2926916dc294/

Change-Id: I0cd0e7c0cfcbd9942736b6a7cbd0929e3878b2e0
'}]
commit_message:
Fix parameters in run-tempest role

Readme of run-tempest job declares variable `tempest_test_regex`
to be a regular expression used to select the tests. But in
order to work this variable needs to be passed to tox with
--regex keyword. Otherwise it is passed as positional parameter
leading to error: "tempest run: error: unrecognized arguments" [1]

The similar issue is with `tempest_test_blacklist`, which is declared
as a blacklist file to skip tests that are not needed, so should be
passed with --blacklist-file parameter.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/59/609959/2/check/tempest-full-profiler-enabled/3054075/ara-report/result/1e906e1a-aa43-42a0-b5fa-2926916dc294/

Change-Id: I0cd0e7c0cfcbd9942736b6a7cbd0929e3878b2e0

commit_message:
RedHat: Use monolithic openstack-swift package

It seems that RDO moved to a sinlge monolithic openstack-swift package
so lets use that instead. This fixes the following problem:

No package matching 'openstack-swift-plugin-swift3

Change-Id: I9a0efd15be4fde3a96e9feb72bed55d45262cb8c

Inherit openstackdocstheme for governance.o.o

instead. Also switch the election website for consistency.

commit_message:
Add mount state rescue block

The mount state could be volitile making it so the "restart-or-reload"
option fails to execute. If this happens the task will now be rescued
and the mount state will be attempted using the regular systemd
module.

Change-Id: I86fc03ad7c72fa4cfdfc598f552f936dda653926
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-03 04:56:16.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I225b740cd85207e2785ab60ba7e626a773617b0c
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I225b740cd85207e2785ab60ba7e626a773617b0c

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 4690, 'name': 'melanie witt', 'display_name': 'melwitt', 'email': 'melwittt@gmail.com', 'username': 'melwitt'}, {'_account_id': 7634, 'name': 'Takashi Natsume', 'email': 'takanattie@gmail.com', 'username': 'natsumet'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14070, 'name': 'Eric Fried', 'email': 'openstack@fried.cc', 'username': 'efried'}, {'_account_id': 14384, 'name': 'Quobyte CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci-external@quobyte.com', 'username': 'quobyteci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15334, 'name': 'Stephen Finucane', 'display_name': 'stephenfin', 'email': 'stephenfin@redhat.com', 'username': 'sfinucan'}, {'_account_id': 15751, 'name': 'Intel PCI CI', 'email': 'pci-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intelpcici', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16128, 'name': 'IBM PowerVM CI', 'email': 'powervmci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powervmci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23498, 'name': 'IBM zVM CI', 'email': 'zvmosci@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'zvmosci'}, {'_account_id': 26515, 'name': 'Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'nova_hyperv_ci@cloudbasesolutions.com', 'username': 'nova_hyperv_ci'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2018-10-18 13:40:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-10-18 13:43:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Is this available in Python 2.7 though? The docs [1] suggest not so something else must be defining it, given that we use this in nova/tests/unit/network/test_linux_net.py. Would be nice to know what before signing-off on this.

[1] https://docs.python.org/2.7/library/unittest.html'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-10-18 14:35:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only zvm: recheck in the comment. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-24387 : SUCCESS in 55m 22s'}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2018-10-18 14:56:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Is this available in Python 2.7 though?

nova.test.TestCase is a sub class of testtools.TestCase (*1).
nova requires testtools>=2.2.0 (*2).
testtools.TestCase is a sub class of unittest.TestCase (*3).
unittest is unittest2 (*4).
In unittest2-1.1.0/unittest2/case.py (*5), the TestCase class has the assertRegex method.
So we can use assertRegex in python 2.7 test.

*1: https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/ce520ee789bf6a46f56de86769d74c095ce432cf/nova/test.py#L168
*2: https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/ce520ee789bf6a46f56de86769d74c095ce432cf/test-requirements.txt#L21
*3: https://github.com/testing-cabal/testtools/blob/2.2.0/testtools/testcase.py#L230
*4: https://github.com/testing-cabal/testtools/blob/2.2.0/testtools/testcase.py#L31
*5: https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/7f/c4/2b0e2d185d9d60772c10350d9853646832609d2f299a8300ab730f199db4/unittest2-1.1.0.tar.gz'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-10-18 15:32:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

The only part I'm skeptical about is

> unittest is unittest2 (*4).

...but it seems to be working at [1], so it must be true.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/tests/unit/network/test_linux_net.py#L635"}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-10-18 15:41:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/611608/1 : FAILURE in 2h 00m 27s'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-10-23 00:39:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> The only part I'm skeptical about is
 > 
 > > unittest is unittest2 (*4).
 > 
 > ...but it seems to be working at [1], so it must be true.
 > 
 > [1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/tests/unit/network/test_linux_net.py#L635

I was too, so I dug a bit and found that the "unittest = try_imports(['unittest2', 'unittest'])" line will try to import the first module and return it if it succeeds, else it will fall back to the second module. Well, unittest2 is in our global-requirements.txt [2], so I think we're guaranteed to succeed importing it. And unittest2 contains backports from the python3 unittest.

What a crazy path to having assertsRegex. Thanks for sharing all of the details, Takashi.

[2] https://github.com/openstack/requirements/blob/f0b9d7c01ae810dd089e24524ab87266bc14041d/global-requirements.txt#L457'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-10-23 00:40:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Gah, forgot to add the link to the source for the try_imports function:

https://github.com/testing-cabal/extras/blob/2695d29743536ec632ead0aeec1ac1b4faf4b5a5/extras/__init__.py#L73'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-10-23 00:41:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

LGTM, +1 so Stephen can sign off'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-10-23 10:47:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

> > The only part I'm skeptical about is
 > >
 > > > unittest is unittest2 (*4).
 > >
 > > ...but it seems to be working at [1], so it must be true.
 > >
 > > [1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/tests/unit/network/test_linux_net.py#L635
 > 
 > I was too, so I dug a bit and found that the "unittest =
 > try_imports(['unittest2', 'unittest'])" line will try to import the
 > first module and return it if it succeeds, else it will fall back
 > to the second module. Well, unittest2 is in our global-requirements.txt
 > [2], so I think we're guaranteed to succeed importing it. And
 > unittest2 contains backports from the python3 unittest.

+1

 > What a crazy path to having assertsRegex. Thanks for sharing all of
 > the details, Takashi.

+1

Thanks for the investigation here. LGTM.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-10-23 13:23:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> unittest2 is in our global-requirements.txt
> [2], so I think we're guaranteed to succeed importing it.

I would have thought we would need it in nova's test-requirements.txt to actually guarantee it.

But that other test has been passing for nearly three years, so I'm pretty confident."}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-10-23 15:38:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> > unittest2 is in our global-requirements.txt
 > > [2], so I think we're guaranteed to succeed importing it.
 > 
 > I would have thought we would need it in nova's test-requirements.txt
 > to actually guarantee it.
 > 
 > But that other test has been passing for nearly three years, so I'm
 > pretty confident.

I think you're right. But I had been thinking global-requirements indirectly requires all the packages in it to be available in a distro for openstack, which seems to be true [3]:

"By adding something to OpenStack global-requirements.txt we are basically demanding that Linux Distros package this for the next release of OpenStack. If they already have, great. If not, we should be cautious of adding it."

So yeah, pretty confident but not _guaranteed_ to be present.

[3] https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/dependency-management.html#for-new-requirements'}]

In Python3, assertRegexpMatches & assertNotRegexpMatches

commit_message:
Use assertRegex instead of assertRegexpMatches

In Python3, assertRegexpMatches & assertNotRegexpMatches
are deprecated in favor of assertRegex and assertNotRegex.

Change-Id: Ifd7cb0d548431095294ad40c99703604f0022888
Closes-Bug: #1798594

With the 2.5.10 release of Ansible, the mysql modules no

commit_message:
Update Ansible to 2.5.10

With the 2.5.10 release of Ansible, the mysql modules no
longer rely on MySQLdb and therefore no longer need the
mysql-python library - it all uses pymysql instead which
is pure python and python3 capable.

Change-Id: Ic8a4ab15663b034b2daa82ce274c31194357e745

commit_message:
Configure Satellite using Ansible instead of a script

- remove rhsm_repository module since it is included with Ansible 2.5
- improve test environment
- convert katello-rhsm-consumer script to Ansible tasks
- gather service and package facts
- use ansible_facts dictionary for facts rather than ansible_[fact]
- set rhsm_server_prefix, rhsm_repo_ca_cert, and rhsm_full_refresh_on_yum
  based on portal or satellite registration

Change-Id: Ifdbcc3b23d5f6ea68dcf904e40a7f44c4b61622e

commit_message:
Implements image certificate verification

This patch implements the feature of support
image certificate verfication when creating
volume from image.

This is a follow up propose from signature verification [1],
also same as Nova certification validation feature [2].

Partial-Implements: bp certificate-validate

[1]: 1faf87284cf674c52a50a9feff6086c05014185c
[2]: 9f0a8999af83bff14acfb0e1adfbcbdbdc2233e6

Change-Id: Iee5b4c825f61d10e39bd953d90fa62cc22430d6f

subject: Use known_hosts module for tripleo-ssh-known-hosts role

messages:
[{'account_id': 27253, 'date': '2018-03-06 22:19:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2018-03-07 00:30:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

i like where this is going, but it doesn't do quite the same thing as we had before.

ssh_known_hosts was a mapping of the hostname (per ansible) to the set of generated hostnames (and IP's) as defined by tripleo-heat-templates (each server has a unique hostname per enabled network).

We then combined that set of hostnames with the public key for the given host to get the known hosts entry which would end up looking like:

https://logs.rdoproject.org/15/539315/6/openstack-check/gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-ovb-3ctlr_1comp-featureset001-master/Z3ae118bf6c3145c0bd2ec773bf87e0a7/overcloud-controller-0/etc/ssh/

So, this needs to consume ssh_known_hosts as input somehow"}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2018-03-07 00:33:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Fixup the docs building

This commit enable users to run `tox -e docs` to build docs for os-ken.
It fixes several issues to ensure the build will succeed.
In addition, the docs from upstream Ryu library is grouped into
archived content. The future work is merging those docs into
the os-ken contents.

Change-Id: I5ee1998e0d2835495650cda530eb0b73c49b091a

commit_message:
Fixes related to installation on Trusty

As the role based macro links are pointing to unreachable destination
and are not required, they will be removed.
Additionally the timesouts are increased for API commands to ES, along
with minor changes around the upstart system manager

Change-Id: I2572bce230af2fd43261c9b0bf903bfd9655959e

commit_message:
Allow create port by subnet_id only

Add a port param to port extension attribute list, then
we can post (create) subnet_id during the port creation.

Change-Id: I9875ff11087a763b797e601a457c4d7e42c5508a
Closes-Bug: #1797140

subject: Schedule VM's on default host aggregate
messages:
[{'account_id': 20191, 'date': '2017-10-18 09:52:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2017-10-18 15:40:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I feel like this problem could be solved by something like https://review.openstack.org/#/c/381912/ since you could set "strict isolation" on all the host aggregates except for the "default" one.

As such, I'm not really in favour of this.'}, {'account_id': 1011, 'date': '2017-10-20 02:31:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Chris: 
Thank you very much for your time for reviewing this specs.

So what you are suggesting is to create a new filter and keep the  existing filter (AggregateImagePropertiesIsolation) as it is and configure this filter as shown below.

New filter: AggregateImagePropertiesStrictIsolation
Existing Filter: AggregateImagePropertiesIsolation

enabled_filters=RetryFilter, ..., AggregateImagePropertiesStrictIsolation, .....

Set “image_strict_matching=True/False” metadata to the host aggregate groups.

What this new filter “AggregateImagePropertiesStrictIsolation” will do:
1. Get “image_strict_matching” metadata from host aggregate group if any

a) If image_strict_matching=True, get the image properties from request specs object that starts with prefix configured in config option “aggregate_image_properties_isolation_namespace“ and match it with the host aggregate group. if it doesn’t match, return False otherwise return True.

b) If image_strict_matching=False, return True (In most cases, operator will end up setting image_strict_matching metadata to True anyway)

If this new filter "AggregateImagePropertiesStrictIsolation" is enabled, then there is no need to configure existing filter "AggregateImagePropertiesIsolation" in the enabled_filters.

P.S: We are not concerned about instance extra specs as operator will create flavors and they will be in full control of how they want to add instance extra specs and host aggregate group metadata.'}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2017-10-26 15:34:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Sorry for the delay...things have been a bit busy.

What I'm actually suggesting is to make a new filter that gathers
aggregate-matching information from *both* extra specs and image properties, combines them, and matches them against the aggregate.

Then there could either be a per-aggregate flag indicating strict matching, or possibly even a per-key namespace modifier to allow strict matching on some things but not on others."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-03-27 15:22:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-10-23 14:42:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Since there have been no updates to this since March and I'm still curious about the applicability of this config option:

https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/configuration/config.html#DEFAULT.default_schedule_zone

And there seems to be some traction around the concept of "forbidden aggregates" in placement:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/603352/

I'm going to abandon this and ask that Dinesh/Tushar review the forbidden aggregates spec from Tetsuro and provide any feedback, either positive or negative, on that spec regarding whether or not it can be used to solve their use case.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-10-23 14:42:27.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-18 09:52:14.000000000', 'message': "Schedule VM's on default host aggregate

The aim of this blueprint is to add a new
`AggregateDefaultHostGroupFilter` scheduler filter.

An operator can define a 'default host aggregate' which has
specific metadata defined. When a VM is booted from an image
which doesn't have special property(e.g. img.os:windows) then
it shall schedule on 'default host aggregate' group.
The new `AggregateDefaultHostGroupFilter` scheduler filter
will help to achieve this.

Change-Id: I87cc7e94043b2e0afa10450861fcec053d40ab93
Implements: bp use-default-host-aggregate-for-vms-booted-using-image-with-no-special-property
"}]
commit_message:
Schedule VM's on default host aggregate

The aim of this blueprint is to add a new
`AggregateDefaultHostGroupFilter` scheduler filter.

An operator can define a 'default host aggregate' which has
specific metadata defined. When a VM is booted from an image
which doesn't have special property(e.g. img.os:windows) then
it shall schedule on 'default host aggregate' group.
The new `AggregateDefaultHostGroupFilter` scheduler filter
will help to achieve this.

Change-Id: I87cc7e94043b2e0afa10450861fcec053d40ab93
Implements: bp use-default-host-aggregate-for-vms-booted-using-image-with-no-special-property
