subject: Bi-directional enforcement of traits
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 7, 'name': 'Jay Pipes', 'email': 'jaypipes@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaypipes'}, {'_account_id': 1011, 'name': 'Tushar Patil', 'email': 'tushar.vitthal.patil@gmail.com', 'username': 'tpatil'}, {'_account_id': 1063, 'name': 'Ed Leafe', 'email': 'ed@leafe.com', 'username': 'ed-leafe'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 5754, 'name': 'Alex Xu', 'email': 'hejie.xu@intel.com', 'username': 'xuhj'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 9708, 'name': 'Balazs Gibizer', 'display_name': 'gibi', 'email': 'gibizer@gmail.com', 'username': 'gibi'}, {'_account_id': 11564, 'name': 'Chris Dent', 'email': 'cdent@anticdent.org', 'username': 'chdent'}, {'_account_id': 11604, 'name': 'sean mooney', 'email': 'smooney@redhat.com', 'username': 'sean-k-mooney'}, {'_account_id': 14070, 'name': 'Eric Fried', 'email': 'openstack@fried.cc', 'username': 'efried'}, {'_account_id': 15888, 'name': 'Zhenyu Zheng', 'email': 'zheng.zhenyu@outlook.com', 'username': 'Kevin_Zheng'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 25625, 'name': 'Tetsuro Nakamura', 'email': 'tetsuro.nakamura.bc@hco.ntt.co.jp', 'username': 'tetsuro0907'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 1011, 'date': '2018-08-20 02:52:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-08-20 10:44:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

This is an interesting idea, but unless we simply cannot come up with a workable alternative, doing this 

* with signalling traits
* with placement side filtering of those traits

is not really the ideal way for placement to work. The query being made to placement should express the kind of filtering it needs or wants to do.

There are many way on the nova side that could be adapted to control these things: aggregates, flavors, image metadata, request filters. Those should be fully explored before we do something like this.

There's no problem with using traits and resource classes to be able to annotate resource providers in a way that is utilized by explicit query parameters, but implicit filtering by types or grouping of traits is not great."}, {'account_id': 1011, 'date': '2018-08-21 01:35:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Chris,

In the last PTG, we had discussed about similar use-cases in specs[1] and nova team came up with forbidden traits as a solution. Forbidden traits solved most of our use-cases except the last one pending is use-case#2 mentioned in the current specs.

Now, since traits can be specified in glance as well, I thought that adding special traits to the resource providers is the ideal solution.

We can also think of adding a new filter as proposed in specs[1] to solve use-case #2.

I will amend alternative solution section to include this info.

I have added this topic in nova-ptg-stein etherpad to get more ideas to solve use-case#2.

[1] : https://review.openstack.org/#/c/381912/'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-08-21 22:03:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2018-08-24 05:27:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-08-24 09:22:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

some clarification on my concerns, in response to tetsuro within'}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2018-08-24 09:48:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > some clarification on my concerns, in response to tetsuro within

Hi, we also have this kind of request, as for your suggestion, are you suggesting that we can have a traits start with ``EXCLUSIVE`` and then a request filter that add ``!EXCLUSIVE`` to the requests if the flavor don't have this kind of extra_spec?"}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-08-24 13:37:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)

This isn't something that needs to be done in Placement, IMHO. This can be done entirely within Nova using the placement request filtering apparatus. Example within.

The use case is fine. I just disagree with the implementation proposed.

Best,

-jay"}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-08-24 13:41:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2018-08-24 14:05:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2018-08-25 10:24:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-08-27 09:55:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2018-08-27 11:50:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Wrote up a PoC in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/596669.
The key additional lines are in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/596669/2/nova/api/openstack/placement/util.py, from which you can see this is a spec of "default forbidden traits".

As you say, an alternative is to do this in nova scheduler filter or to let operators do the thing manually by having all the other flavors have the forbidden traits... but I still think offloading this to placement is the best idea, because we'd like to reduce the number of the nova filters (thanks to placement!), and we'd like to have operators have an easy life.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-08-27 15:53:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Wrote up a PoC in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/596669.
 > The key additional lines are in
 > https://review.openstack.org/#/c/596669/2/nova/api/openstack/placement/util.py,
 > from which you can see this is a spec of "default forbidden
 > traits".
 > 
 > As you say, an alternative is to do this in nova scheduler filter
 > or to let operators do the thing manually by having all the other
 > flavors have the forbidden traits... but I still think offloading
 > this to placement is the best idea, because we'd like to reduce the
 > number of the nova filters (thanks to placement!), and we'd like to
 > have operators have an easy life.

-1

It's not placement's job to make operators have an easy life. Operators should be required to set up their deployment's providers with an appropriate set of traits, put providers into appropriate aggregates, put appropriate metadata on their own images and flavors, and configure *Nova* with the set of configuration options that would allow these things to be used properly.

I am 100% opposed to expanding the scope of placement to "make operators lives easier by storing random data that should be in Nova configuration options".

-jay'}, {'account_id': 1011, 'date': '2018-08-28 07:10:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1011, 'date': '2018-08-28 08:05:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1011, 'date': '2018-08-28 08:06:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Added solution #2 in Alternative Solution Section.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-08-28 12:18:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-08-28 12:20:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I'm sorry, I'm not going to go along with the encoding of a "SPECIAL_" prefix on a trait.

These use cases can and should be solved before getting to placement.

-jay'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-08-28 21:54:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I'm still -1, same as my earlier comment, duplicated here:

This is an interesting idea, but unless we simply cannot come up with a workable alternative, doing this 

with signalling traits
with placement side filtering of those traits
is not really the ideal way for placement to work. The query being made to placement should express the kind of filtering it needs or wants to do.

There are many way on the nova side that could be adapted to control these things: aggregates, flavors, image metadata, request filters. Those should be fully explored before we do something like this.

There's no problem with using traits and resource classes to be able to annotate resource providers in a way that is utilized by explicit query parameters, but implicit filtering by types or grouping of traits is not great."}, {'account_id': 1011, 'date': '2018-08-29 02:41:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1011, 'date': '2018-08-29 02:42:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hi Chris and Jay,

Thank you for your feedback. I understand your point that our use-cases should/can be handled in nova rather than placement.

If overall decision is to handle our use-case #2 in nova, then I will modify specs [1] and re-propose it for stein release.

[1] : https://review.openstack.org/#/c/381912'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-08-29 13:03:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Thank you for your feedback. I understand your point that our
 > use-cases should/can be handled in nova rather than placement.

Just to be clear, my objection isn't specifically that these things should be handled in nova rather than placement, but rather that the proposed solution does something in placement that is not good for the placement code. The problem is that it uses the _value_ of a trait to control the flow of code: we need specific code that understand the value of "SPECIAL_". The value of a trait is not something the placement code should ever know. Instead it should know if a trait is required, forbidden or something else expressed by a query made to placement.

This is an important thing to keep in mind when considering ways of using placement. Fundamentally you can put whatever data you need to into it, but the code needs to remain generic and unaware of the value of that data.'}, {'account_id': 1011, 'date': '2018-08-30 07:40:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hi Chris,

Yes, I have understood the principle behind placement design and I totally agree with you and Jay.

As mentioned in use-case #2, since the image doesn't have any metadata or traits associated with it, there is no way we can restrict it to land on specific aggregates in the current nova.

I will abandon this specs and re-propose old specs[1] to implement our use-case #2 in nova code.

Thank you for your feedback.

[1] : https://review.openstack.org/#/c/381912"}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-08-30 13:15:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Tushar, will you be in Denver for the PTG?'}, {'account_id': 1011, 'date': '2018-09-04 01:07:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hi Jay,

Yes, I wil attend PTG this time. 

Looking forward to discuss on this topic with you all.

Thank you.'}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2018-09-05 18:18:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

/me catches up on my reading...

I agree with the sentiments expressed by Jay. This is not what traits were designed to do, and it seems this is building Nova-specific functionality into Placement. You can already do this in Nova.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-09-10 14:26:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1011, 'date': '2018-09-10 20:19:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hi Dan,

This solution will solve our use-case #2 and also it will not require `inject metadata` feature to be enabled on the glance side.

If the query parameter is too long, it gives 414 error but I think it's possible to increase that limit in apache2 using "LimitRequestLine" option.

I will upload a new specs which will include your proposed solution to solve our use-case #2.
Thank you very much for your suggestion.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-09-19 18:53:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

At the PTG we concluded that these use cases will be satisfied by "forbidden aggregates" [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/603352'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-10-23 14:31:00.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/603352/ supposedly solves this same problem in a more generic way, so let's abandon this spec which is contentious (I also don't like the idea of encoding logic into trait names - that's just a workaround for not having metadata).

However, I haven't seen Tushar comment on Tetsuro's forbidden aggregates spec and that spec was, the last time I looked, light on details for how it solves Tushar's exclusion problem in nova, so before we move forward with that I want to make sure Tushar has had a chance to review it and make sure it will solve his original problem."}]

commit_message:
Bi-directional enforcement of traits

Add `SPECIAL_*` traits to resource providers and if these
special traits are not requested in flavor or images, then
those particular resource providers will not be returned
in the ``GET /allocation_candidates`` API call.

Change-Id: Ib3d170778b5bbd19738920514d434e8dc976a337

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-18 01:50:28.000000000', 'message': 'remove basic distro packages from the repo server

The build process was installing the general distro packages on the
build target. While this works it installed extra packages on
environments resulting in unforseen issues. In this case the horizon
distro packages installed apache into the repo server which can, and
does, create a conflict with nginx.

Change-Id: I1fb6fa641085367ae3192ade2f289b6247c6c377
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
remove basic distro packages from the repo server

The build process was installing the general distro packages on the
build target. While this works it installed extra packages on
environments resulting in unforseen issues. In this case the horizon
distro packages installed apache into the repo server which can, and
does, create a conflict with nginx.

Change-Id: I1fb6fa641085367ae3192ade2f289b6247c6c377
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

Currently, the SCSI lun id is assigned by storage. But Storwize may
assigned the same SCSI lun id for different volumes on different i/o
groups. The wrong volume may be discovered with the same wwpn and same
lun id.

This patch reverts the patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/360394/,
Storwize volume driver calculates an unused SCSI lun id and sends the

commit_message:
Storwize: self assign the SCSI lun id for volume attaching

Currently, the SCSI lun id is assigned by storage. But Storwize may
assigned the same SCSI lun id for different volumes on different i/o
groups. The wrong volume may be discovered with the same wwpn and same
lun id.

This patch reverts the patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/360394/,
Storwize volume driver calculates an unused SCSI lun id and sends the
SCSI lun id to storage.
To avoid the problem of patch 360394,  this patch retries 3 times to
map volume to host if there is CMMVC5879E error.

Change-Id: I3d3c61f913ff7ec8d35c8105cecc1a51accd21e7
Closes-Bug: 1757922
(cherry picked from commit c42aba603b394789da1a09822510ee3b428c1069)
(cherry picked from commit 542662d3a8e4e46af4d762732dd79d90f11c57dc)

commit_message:
Handling type's multiattach extra specs in API task flow

This patch fixs two issues related to multiattach extra specs:

1. Volume's multiattach attribute will always be False if it's
   created by a multiattach type while type is specified in source
   volume, snapshot, image metadata or config file, related patch [1].
2. 'MULTIATTACH_POLICY' will not be validated if multiattach flag is
   specified in the volume type that from source volume, snapshot,
   image metadata or config file [2].

[1]: a32e24ff3e2c3083b42dd3654355f8c101363147
[2]: ff30971d1f7b1f4febdef9358a999017bea2296d
Closes-Bug: #1770671

Conflicts:
    cinder/tests/unit/volume/flows/test_create_volume_flow.py
    cinder/volume/flows/api/create_volume.py

Most conflicts caused by the az-in-volumetype work done in
I4e6aa7af707bd063e7edf2b0bf28e3071ad5c67a and
Ibe937d5a97d685f5d9c3f8c03c5c384bb02a6942.

Change-Id: Ibec0656d9ead726ca12e62091fda74c04ec99eda
(cherry picked from commit 23f26555b3d4d1a089d09cd2335c39a73997c55e)

commit_message:
Be cleaner when unstacking a failed deployment

This prevents an error from "find" due to the
dir not existing.

Change-Id: I679f42ee88f1e8ae6d656195f5377a8b06f1cee9

If these are configurable per aggregate, that would mean that metadata would have to be set for this to have any effect. So I don't understand why we need new config options. In other words, the behavior will only change if the operator sets the strict isolation on the aggregate. If they don't set this, the behavior remains the same as it currently is."}, {'account_id': 10618, 'date': '2016-10-11 10:17:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I looked old conversation about 'per aggregate', I think this should be removed from the spec, the reason that I see: imagine we have one non-strict aggregate without metadata and one aggregate with 'key=value' with strict isolation, so if we have image/flavor with 'key=value' it could be scheduled on both, but I think it should be placed only on the second (or the strictness will be lost). Maybe somebody will have other opinion. As for me, I want to leave only global config option (as in current PoC)."}, {'account_id': 10618, 'date': '2016-10-11 10:21:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 10618, 'date': '2016-10-11 10:21:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(8 comments)

I'm reasonably sure that currently if a flavor extra-specifies "aggregate_instance_extra_specs:pinned"="false" then it will *only* match against a host that is part of an aggregate with metadata "pinned=false".  It will not match against a host that isn't part of a host aggregate.

Second, I don't agree with the all-or-nothing approach specified here where a flag on the image properties or flavor extra-specs makes the rest of the image properties or flavor extra-specs match differently.  I think it would make much more sense to add a namespace to the key on the aggregate, which would influence how the match is made against a corresponding key in *either* the image or the flavor.

Thus, if I specify {"strict:storage": "ssd"} then an instance will only schedule on hosts in this aggregate if either the image or the flavor specifies ssd storage.'}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2017-10-03 16:51:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

In regards to Sylvain Bauzas' comments, I think it's okay for a host in multiple aggregates to be disqualified by only one of the aggregates failing to match (if the match is strict).  If I have a host with SSDs and rare FPGAs, I think it might be reasonable that only instances that want *both* SSD and FPGA would land on that host."}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2017-10-03 17:03:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

I think I see the source of confusion about the behaviour when the image/flavor asks for something that doesn't match against an aggregate (or a host isn't part of an aggregate).

It looks to me like AggregateImagePropertiesIsolation *will* match if the image specifies something that isn't in the aggregate metadata or the host isn't part of an aggregate, but AggregateInstanceExtraSpecsFilter will *not* match."}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2017-10-03 17:15:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

Looking at the code, AggregateImagePropertiesIsolation and AggregateInstanceExtraSpecsFilter are actually doing two different things.

AggregateInstanceExtraSpecsFilter will ensure that if you ask for something in the flavor then the host is part of a host aggregate that provides that thing.

AggregateImagePropertiesIsolation will ensure that if you specify something in a host aggregate then only images that also specify that thing will be allowed to run in that host aggregate.  This is actually very similar to the strict isolation that is being talked about.

The interesting thing here is that we currently have no way to specify something on the image and ensure that it gets matched by the host, and we currently have no way to provide strict isolation for things specified in the flavor extra-specs.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2017-10-04 09:16:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

(8 comments)

Hi Chris,

Thank you for review. Please see the inline replies for your comments.'}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2017-10-04 15:36:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2017-10-04 15:48:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

(2 comments)

Looks like I was wrong about AggregateImagePropertiesIsolation.  It will only fail the filter if the key is present in both the aggregate and the image, but the values are different.'}, {'account_id': 7166, 'date': '2017-10-04 16:39:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

Adding melwitt since she said she thought this used to work and then was regressed in Ocata, so if that is true, it would be good to know what regressed it and why, and if we should just fix that.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-02-22 17:39:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14:

> Adding melwitt since she said she thought this used to work and
 > then was regressed in Ocata, so if that is true, it would be good
 > to know what regressed it and why, and if we should just fix that.

Thanks for adding me.

I've recently learned about this one from Sylvain. What used to work and doesn't now are custom image properties. Prior to the conversion of the filter to use the RequestSpec object, people used to be able to use custom image properties. Now they can only use the set of canned fields in ImageMetaProps. And that's expected and fine.

On the strict isolation part of this, the filter has always behaved in the same way, i.e. it has always also scheduled to hosts that did not have the image property set. So this isn't a regression in the behavior of the filter in that regard, so it's correct that this be treated as a new feature."}, {'account_id': 20191, 'date': '2018-03-01 10:50:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 20191, 'date': '2018-03-01 10:54:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 20191, 'date': '2018-03-01 11:05:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-03-02 12:10:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17: Code-Review-1

My problem with this spec is three-fold:

1) I don't want to add yet another scheduler filter that requires yet another metadata key for host aggregates. The work in the "Support traits in Glance" blueprint (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/541507/) will allow for traits to be associated with image properties (image metadata) and have the Nova scheduler bundle up those traits to the placement API during its initial request to get compute nodes that meet a set of resource and trait requirements.

2) When a compute node is associated with multiple host aggregates, and those host aggregates have the image_strict_isolation metadata key set to different values, there's no way to determine which value to use. This is a fundamental problem with nova host aggregates that doesn't exist in placement aggregates.

3) For things that are *consumable*, we should be using resource classes. Windows licenses (which are consumed per socket or per core) are an example of a consumable resource IMHO, and should be tracked as such. I understand that the tenant/project is *not* a consumable resource, and that some operators would like to completely isolate certain tenants to certain collections of compute nodes. The way to do that in placement is to apply a custom trait called CUSTOM_TRAIT_PROJECT_GENERAL to all compute nodes that can house general-purpose workloads and then apply CUSTOM_TRAIT_PROJECT_<UUID> traits to those compute nodes that you wish to isolate to a specific tenant. Dan's pre-filter requests blueprint work would allow the operator to attach the CUSTOM_TRAIT_PROJECT_GENERAL trait to requests where the host aggregate isn't associated with a particular tenant and the CUSTOM_TRAIT_PROJECT_<UUID> trait to requests that are for tenants that should go to an isolated set of hosts.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-03-20 22:25:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

> My problem with this spec is three-fold:
 > ...

Does 3) mean that this spec isn't needed to get strict isolation once the placement request filtering work lands?

That is, will it be possible with placement request filtering to say "if the special image property is not present on the image, limit the request to hosts with CUSTOM_TRAIT_GENERAL" and "if the special image property is present on the image, limit the request to hosts with CUSTOM_TRAIT_SPECIAL"?'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-03-21 14:20:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

> > My problem with this spec is three-fold:
 > > ...
 > 
 > Does 3) mean that this spec isn't needed to get strict isolation
 > once the placement request filtering work lands?
 > 
 > That is, will it be possible with placement request filtering to
 > say "if the special image property is not present on the image,
 > limit the request to hosts with CUSTOM_TRAIT_GENERAL" and "if the
 > special image property is present on the image, limit the request
 > to hosts with CUSTOM_TRAIT_SPECIAL"?

It's both the placement request filter and the forbidden traits work that will make this redundant.

The placement request filter work would have nova-api add a ?required=CUSTOM_WINDOWS filter to the placement request to winnow results when the image is a Windows image to a specific set of hosts.

The forbidden traits work will allow the nova-api to add a trait that should NOT be found to the request if a particular tenant or image. For instance, if the request is for a non-Windows image, the placement request filter would add a ?required=!CUSTOM_WINDOWS query parameter to the placement request and placement will return all hosts which do not have that trait.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-03-21 17:23:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

Thanks Jay, for clarifying that.'}, {'account_id': 1011, 'date': '2018-03-22 02:00:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

Jay is right. I think we can abandon this specs if we all agree to get following things done in Rocky.

Placement request filter : https://review.openstack.org/#/c/544585/ 
Forbidden traits :  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/548915/
Support traits in glance : https://review.openstack.org/#/c/541507/'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-10-23 14:23:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 17:

> Jay is right. I think we can abandon this specs if we all agree to get following things done in Rocky.

Placement request filter : https://review.openstack.org/#/c/544585/ 
Forbidden traits :  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/548915/
Support traits in glance : https://review.openstack.org/#/c/541507/

--

Those were all completed in Rocky. There are two related specs for this:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/593475/

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/603352/

The former is supposedly superseded by the latter, but I haven't seen Tushar comment on it yet and I'm not sure it solves the same problem, or in a simple enough way to make it usable/scalable. But given this spec hasn't been updated since May and is targeted to Rocky still I'm going to abandon it."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-10-23 14:23:59.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Strict isolation of group of hosts for images

The aim of this blueprint is to add a new
`AggregateImagePropertiesStrictIsolation` scheduler filter.

An operator wants to schedule instances having a specific
image property on a pre-defined group of hosts. In addition,
the operator would also like to prevent instances without
the special image property from being placed on this group
of hosts.

Implements: bp strict-isolation-of-group-of-hosts-for-image-and-flavor
Change-Id: If1f4a5eec06305daf3044ebac8a2e67dd45d0b85

@Matt: The blueprint for image signing was incorrectly marked as completed last cycle when the feature is not in fact completed. That's why we are trying to get the initial spec and blueprint re-approved for Ocata. The initial spec describes cert validation, as well as changes needed to make the feature more usable. Both of these work items are still outstanding, and are addressed by specs under the same blueprint.

This trusted flavors spec describes a change which would make the feature more usable, and would allow users to verify signed images in clouds where unverified images are also supported."}, {'account_id': 15524, 'date': '2017-03-13 13:52:42.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from bp/nova-support-image-signing to bp/nova-trusted-flavors'}, {'account_id': 15524, 'date': '2017-03-13 14:09:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6804, 'date': '2017-03-13 14:11:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-03-13 14:15:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified+1

(4 comments)

Relatively strong -1 on this one from me, Dane. It's good functionality and the use case is well-scoped, however I strongly disagree on the implementation coupling this functionality to flavors. I actually believe that will lead to a bad user experience (see inline as to why) and think a simpler alternative would be to just add a new "verify_image" or "verify_image_signature" key to the POST /servers request payload.

Best,

-jay'}, {'account_id': 7012, 'date': '2017-04-07 20:41:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 7012, 'date': '2017-04-07 20:45:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

commit_message:
API Option for Signature Verification

This spec describes a change which would allow end users to request
that Nova perform image signature verification when booting a new
instance, instead of relying solely on the existing configuration
option.

Change-Id: I764b2a07a974119762c782203960c8d8f250dbef
Blueprint: nova-api-option-signatures

messages: [{'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-09-29 23:49:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8099, 'date': '2018-10-23 14:07:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-29 23:49:29.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I6821c9ce57f31bea43d165910008cc86e310173b
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I6821c9ce57f31bea43d165910008cc86e310173b
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-17 02:30:44.000000000', 'message': "The validation of iscsi session should be case insensitive

The validation of iscsi session should be case insensitive since IPv6
address is case insensitive. If the portal address are all lower cases,
and the address get from 'iscsiadm -m session' contain upper cases,
the validation of iscsi session will failed, the loop will be endless.

Change-Id: Ief5108e40f13cc53d8d9e9c5d1a5054f58f72aa0
Closes-bug: #1793627
(cherry picked from commit 8782c4accfea8a745676517c1880810cfa07feac)
(cherry picked from commit e01e5db822b29f898763197ec98e2c31f0b05c53)
"}]
commit_message:
The validation of iscsi session should be case insensitive

The validation of iscsi session should be case insensitive since IPv6
address is case insensitive. If the portal address are all lower cases,
and the address get from 'iscsiadm -m session' contain upper cases,
the validation of iscsi session will failed, the loop will be endless.

Change-Id: Ief5108e40f13cc53d8d9e9c5d1a5054f58f72aa0
Closes-bug: #1793627
(cherry picked from commit 8782c4accfea8a745676517c1880810cfa07feac)
(cherry picked from commit e01e5db822b29f898763197ec98e2c31f0b05c53)

commit_message:
Fix a LOG.warning which didn't work properly

Found when checking ci logs here:

http://logs.openstack.org/41/587041/3/check/ironic-inspector-tempest-dsvm-discovery/7912a3a/logs/screen-ironic-inspector.txt.gz#_Oct_17_16_44_39_477744

It's supposed to be printing missing arguments when constructing
an http client.

The http client is supposed to be removed ?soon?, so if the fix is
not required, please let me know.

Change-Id: I2bad387afa2ede56da7164a7bc9a5ac461e78d9c

commit_message:
Add statement explaining "tips" job configuration

The configuration of the periodic "tips" jobs in .zuul.yaml may
be confusing, particularly after a stable branch is cut.   Add a
comment explaining what we're doing and why to reduce confusion.

Change-Id: I7bf676ac972af835c7a6b8d04815629752685765

commit_message:
Refactor periodic "tips" jobs

Two changes:
1 - declare the abstract base tips jobs 'abstract'
2 - add a branch matcher to where the periodic tips jobs
    are invoked in the project definition so that they only
    apply to the master branch

Change-Id: If80ead2796c370b9539a0d7dd12bb8d35de8abcf

commit_message:
Fix tgz plan upload error on some OSes

This change adds explicit file extensions to file validation for plan
tarball upload to avoid mime type inconsistencies across different OSes

Story: 2004116
Task: 27539

Change-Id: I7f479fca35a2a72421b68ea528509e1e3b7f3803
(cherry picked from commit c5a80e28e7f145b506e4f5e8fe0cabaa5b151be3)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-19 12:40:23.000000000', 'message': '[Queens/Pike] Re-registry with new rhel_reg parameters on upgrade.

Currently, when the overcloud nodes were registered in Satellite
or portal during deployment via extraconfig/pre_deploy/rhel-registration
and an upgrade is performed passing different values for rhel_reg_repos
these changes are not taken into account. As a consequence, we end up
running the upgrade steps with the previous repositories configured
during deployment.

This patch allows us to re-register using the --force option using
the new values inserted at the pre-upgrade step. To allow this, we
make use of the RHELRegistrationAction parameter to change the
action in which the RHELRegistrationDeployment resource is run.
By setting it to UPDATE, the SoftwareDeployment resource will
be triggered during the stack update which takes place in the
upgrade. Passing the force option will force the re-execution
of rhel-registration script even though it was executed previously
during deployment (bypassing the /mnt/state/var/lib/rhsm/rhsm.ok
guard.

Change-Id: I51a1dad5f422756d0a8c4deff81c170be7d944d3
Related-Bug: #1797138
(cherry picked from commit 18987fbe32316e3ed8c7afcc3bf6199a10d0ee8b)
'}]
commit_message:
[Queens/Pike] Re-registry with new rhel_reg parameters on upgrade.

Currently, when the overcloud nodes were registered in Satellite
or portal during deployment via extraconfig/pre_deploy/rhel-registration
and an upgrade is performed passing different values for rhel_reg_repos
these changes are not taken into account. As a consequence, we end up
running the upgrade steps with the previous repositories configured
during deployment.

This patch allows us to re-register using the --force option using
the new values inserted at the pre-upgrade step. To allow this, we
make use of the RHELRegistrationAction parameter to change the
action in which the RHELRegistrationDeployment resource is run.
By setting it to UPDATE, the SoftwareDeployment resource will
be triggered during the stack update which takes place in the
upgrade. Passing the force option will force the re-execution
of rhel-registration script even though it was executed previously
during deployment (bypassing the /mnt/state/var/lib/rhsm/rhsm.ok
guard.

Change-Id: I51a1dad5f422756d0a8c4deff81c170be7d944d3
Related-Bug: #1797138
(cherry picked from commit 18987fbe32316e3ed8c7afcc3bf6199a10d0ee8b)

[{'created': '2018-10-23 02:08:03.000000000', 'message': 'Clean up .gitignore file

When you create the placement document locally with `tox -e docs`,
some of the files are created under the `doc/source/_static` directory
and are tracked by git because the .gitignore file is not set
appropriately. This patch fixes it cleaning up old nova configurations
in the .gitignore file.

Change-Id: I1ecae90c9ba1cccdcd4befec3513ba2fdacb4cea
'}]
commit_message:
Clean up .gitignore file

When you create the placement document locally with `tox -e docs`,
some of the files are created under the `doc/source/_static` directory
and are tracked by git because the .gitignore file is not set
appropriately. This patch fixes it cleaning up old nova configurations
in the .gitignore file.

Change-Id: I1ecae90c9ba1cccdcd4befec3513ba2fdacb4cea

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-16 18:36:49.000000000', 'message': 'Only b64encode ssl_ca if it needs it

The description of the ssl_ca config option in config.yaml states
that the certificate should be base64 encoded. But if it is then
the charm b64encodes it again when sending the ca down the client
relations. This change gates encoding the ca on whether it is
already encoded.

Change-Id: I9828d7567fd7f04cd0d80229ea1ff1275ea4269e
Closes-Bug: #1798066
'}]
commit_message:
Only b64encode ssl_ca if it needs it

The description of the ssl_ca config option in config.yaml states
that the certificate should be base64 encoded. But if it is then
the charm b64encodes it again when sending the ca down the client
relations. This change gates encoding the ca on whether it is
already encoded.

Change-Id: I9828d7567fd7f04cd0d80229ea1ff1275ea4269e
Closes-Bug: #1798066

commit_message:
Remove WindowsDriver mapping

The WindowsDriver was renamed to WindowsISCSIDriver in change
I3877491463dce3d46f7ac0e194ffdf46a0e7c84c to avoid confusion with the
Windows SMB driver. It has now been two release cycles and the backward
compatibility mapping can now be removed.

Change-Id: I602cccac73b6dc8d0b0824a5dffb0373c151452e
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
[Ocata/Pike/Queens] Make rhel-registration scripts location absolute.

This patch modifies the script files location to be executed
during the SoftwareDeployment resources in rhel-registration.yaml.
The main purpose of this is to ensure we are running the right
script content related to a branch, for example, after an upgrade.

Change-Id: If77acb78c63511054e17d553982e19e748c88992
Related-Bug: #1797138
(cherry picked from commit 91746c290be5fc374ad2389694779a7b57351c81)

[{'created': '2018-10-22 18:20:16.000000000', 'message': 'Correct python3 detection logic

Use python3 only on platforms where this is the default and avoids the
problem where python3 is used when it was installed by the user.

python3 will be used for CentOS>=8,RHEL>=8,Fedora>=28

Change-Id: If65d2c3d42818942a9b05ba654dfdd998bcced61
'}]
commit_message:
Correct python3 detection logic

Use python3 only on platforms where this is the default and avoids the
problem where python3 is used when it was installed by the user.

python3 will be used for CentOS>=8,RHEL>=8,Fedora>=28

Change-Id: If65d2c3d42818942a9b05ba654dfdd998bcced61

commit_message:
Change Swift storage directory to /srv/node/d1

So far Swift on the undercloud used /srv/node/1, while Swift deployed by
TripleO uses /srv/node/d1 as default. When moving to a containerized
undercloud, this needs to be adopted as well.

This requires updating the ring files as well as moving the directory.

Change-Id: I66e1600a121869d17cfdba86910944e718c774f6

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-31 09:21:47.000000000', 'message': 'do not flush selection on "old" boot source

This fixes an issue introduced by watchers:
when page initialized images watchers called before
select boot source watcher.it leads to sutiation when
we specify selection from user input and flush it on
updateBootSource. as a result page come to
inconsistent state described in the bug.
Perhaps, this requires big refactoring but  in the
current patch we do not flush selection if boot type
was not changed. it allows to use image, snapshot,
volume from context as ctrl.selection.

Change-Id: I4b23071a2a9e2c02cc1f46713165e5cb5155894f
Closes-Bug: #1710890
(cherry picked from commit 48862eb9b7f5789dee3362d9103416628c5d3e76)
'}]
commit_message:
do not flush selection on "old" boot source

This fixes an issue introduced by watchers:
when page initialized images watchers called before
select boot source watcher.it leads to sutiation when
we specify selection from user input and flush it on
updateBootSource. as a result page come to
inconsistent state described in the bug.
Perhaps, this requires big refactoring but  in the
current patch we do not flush selection if boot type
was not changed. it allows to use image, snapshot,
volume from context as ctrl.selection.

Change-Id: I4b23071a2a9e2c02cc1f46713165e5cb5155894f
Closes-Bug: #1710890
(cherry picked from commit 48862eb9b7f5789dee3362d9103416628c5d3e76)

should be no conflicts between the cleanup in that and the new volume
cleanup in the except block. The remove_volume_connection() ->

exception and warns about the instance disappearing (it was never
really on the destination in the first place). The attachment_delete()
in _rollback_live_migration() is contingent on there being an
old_vol_attachment in migrate_data, which there isn't because
pre_live_migration() raised instead of returning.

commit_message:
Ensure attachment cleanup on failure in driver.pre_live_migration

Previously, if the call to driver.pre_live_migration failed (which in
libvirt can happen with a DestinationDiskExists exception), the
compute manager wouldn't rollback/cleanup volume attachments, leading
to corrupt volume attachment information, and, depending on the
backend, the instance being unable to access its volume. This patch
moves the driver.pre_live_migration call inside the existing
try/except, allowing the compute manager to properly rollback/cleanup
volume attachments.

The compute manager has its own _rollback_live_migration() cleanup in
case the pre_live_migration() RPC call to the destination fails. There
should be no conflicts between the cleanup in that and the new volume
cleanup in the except block. The remove_volume_connection() ->
driver_detach() -> detach_volume() call catches the InstanceNotFound
exception and warns about the instance disappearing (it was never
really on the destination in the first place). The attachment_delete()
in _rollback_live_migration() is contingent on there being an
old_vol_attachment in migrate_data, which there isn't because
pre_live_migration() raised instead of returning.

Change-Id: I67f66e95d69ae6df22e539550a3eac697ea8f5d8
Closes-bug: 1778206

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-11-25 08:29:48.000000000', 'message': 'Unify the time format about get_time_frame

The parameters of time(begin and end) should unify format at
the /v1/storage/dataframes invoking workflow.

1. In API controllers, change the time format from datetime.datetime
   to timestamp.
   begin_ts = ck_utils.dt2ts(begin); end_ts = ck_utils.dt2ts(end)

2. In storage module, change the time format from timestamp to
   datetime.datetime again.
   ck_utils.ts2dt(begin); ck_utils.ts2dt(end)

So the time format should always be datetime.datetime, the two phases
format changes are redundance and unnecessary.

Change-Id: Ie570ddab079196164e45a8b0182bc2e878778827
'}]
commit_message:
Unify the time format about get_time_frame

The parameters of time(begin and end) should unify format at
the /v1/storage/dataframes invoking workflow.

1. In API controllers, change the time format from datetime.datetime
   to timestamp.
   begin_ts = ck_utils.dt2ts(begin); end_ts = ck_utils.dt2ts(end)

2. In storage module, change the time format from timestamp to
   datetime.datetime again.
   ck_utils.ts2dt(begin); ck_utils.ts2dt(end)

So the time format should always be datetime.datetime, the two phases
format changes are redundance and unnecessary.

Change-Id: Ie570ddab079196164e45a8b0182bc2e878778827

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-03-07 09:17:50.000000000', 'message': 'Robust the mapping comparison

In two situations below, we can't get the result as expected:

1. creat a mapping, the value in mapping and meter data in ceilometer
has different decimal place.

    cloudkitty hashmap-group-create -n volume_g
    cloudkitty hashmap-service-create -n volume
    cloudkitty hashmap-mapping-create -f * -t flat -v 1.0 -c 1 -g *

    and even is the size of volume is 1 in ceilometer, there price
    will always be 0 because '1'!='1.0'.

2. when call quote from python-cloudkittyclient with number instead
of string in desc dict.

    cloudkitty hashmap-group-create -n volume_g
    cloudkitty hashmap-service-create -n volume
    cloudkitty hashmap-mapping-create -f * -t flat -v 50 -c 1 -g *

    then we call quote as quote(resources=
    [{"desc": {"size": 50}, "volume": 50, "service": "volume"}]}),
    then we'll get the 0 because of 50!='50'.

Change-Id: I60033b71c61806a2978096be073b919a10f0f29b
'}, {'created': '2017-03-07 09:21:39.000000000', 'message': 'Robust the mapping comparison

    then we call quote as quote(resources=
    [{"desc": {"size": 50}, "volume": 50, "service": "volume"}]}),
    then we'll get the 0 because of 50!='50'.

Change-Id: I60033b71c61806a2978096be073b919a10f0f29b
'}, {'created': '2017-03-14 02:41:22.000000000', 'message': 'Robust the mapping comparison

In two situations below, we can't get the result as expected:

1. creat a mapping, the value in mapping and meter data in ceilometer
has different decimal place.

    cloudkitty hashmap-group-create -n volume_g
    cloudkitty hashmap-service-create -n volume
    cloudkitty hashmap-mapping-create -f * -t flat -v 1.0 -c 1 -g *

    and even if the size of volume is 1 in ceilometer, the price
    of this volume will always be 0 because of '1'!='1.0'.

2. when call quote from python-cloudkittyclient with number instead
of string in desc dict.

    cloudkitty hashmap-group-create -n volume_g
    cloudkitty hashmap-service-create -n volume
    cloudkitty hashmap-mapping-create -f * -t flat -v 50 -c 1 -g *

    then we call quote as quote(resources=
    [{"desc": {"size": 50}, "volume": 50, "service": "volume"}]}),
    then we'll get the 0 because of 50!='50'.

Change-Id: I60033b71c61806a2978096be073b919a10f0f29b
'}]
commit_message:
Robust the mapping comparison

In two situations below, we can't get the result as expected:

1. creat a mapping, the value in mapping and meter data in ceilometer
has different decimal place.

    cloudkitty hashmap-group-create -n volume_g
    cloudkitty hashmap-service-create -n volume
    cloudkitty hashmap-mapping-create -f * -t flat -v 1.0 -c 1 -g *

    and even if the size of volume is 1 in ceilometer, the price
    of this volume will always be 0 because of '1'!='1.0'.

2. when call quote from python-cloudkittyclient with number instead
of string in desc dict.

    cloudkitty hashmap-group-create -n volume_g
    cloudkitty hashmap-service-create -n volume
    cloudkitty hashmap-mapping-create -f * -t flat -v 50 -c 1 -g *

    then we call quote as quote(resources=
    [{"desc": {"size": 50}, "volume": 50, "service": "volume"}]}),
    then we'll get the 0 because of 50!='50'.

Change-Id: I60033b71c61806a2978096be073b919a10f0f29b

[{'created': '2018-10-22 11:12:03.000000000', 'message': "Fix BMC IP address detection on CoreOS images

On CoreOS images, IPA runs in a Debian Jessie chroot which uses mawk as
its default awk implementation. However, mawk doesn't support POSIX
character classes such as [:space:], which means get_bmc_address() fails
to parse the BMC IP address from the output of ipmitool.

This patch replaces the use of [[:space:]] by [ \t] which is equivalent
for the purpose of parsing the output of ipmitool. Note that matching on
tab characters is not strictly required as the packaged version of
ipmitool only uses space characters, but is left in case tabs are used
in other versions.

Change-Id: I0e3306a4d4584ca28e03608e9f7270b770960a39
Story: #2004121
Task: #27571
(cherry picked from commit 8eecadb0a8a36eb541b96d6d2fcce12dbb121181)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix BMC IP address detection on CoreOS images

On CoreOS images, IPA runs in a Debian Jessie chroot which uses mawk as
its default awk implementation. However, mawk doesn't support POSIX
character classes such as [:space:], which means get_bmc_address() fails
to parse the BMC IP address from the output of ipmitool.

This patch replaces the use of [[:space:]] by [ \t] which is equivalent
for the purpose of parsing the output of ipmitool. Note that matching on
tab characters is not strictly required as the packaged version of
ipmitool only uses space characters, but is left in case tabs are used
in other versions.

Change-Id: I0e3306a4d4584ca28e03608e9f7270b770960a39
Story: #2004121
Task: #27571
(cherry picked from commit 8eecadb0a8a36eb541b96d6d2fcce12dbb121181)

commit_message:
Ensure that the flavor/network facts are available to all targets

Currently the registered result for the flavor creation is
only available on localhost. To ensure that it is available
on all hosts we first create it using the designated service
host, then fetch the details and set a fact for all hosts.

We do the same for the management network fact.

In order to achieve this, shade needs to be present on the
target host, so we add it into the octavia venv. We also make
sure that the octavia service account is used, because that's
where the flavor and network objects were created and only that
account has access to them.

Change-Id: I85b533dbb5fa29382dc615b584b21ff1a5d67a46

commit_message:
refactor the check_state function in orchestrator

_check_state of Orchestrator and check_state of Worker are the same.
this patch refactor this by deleting the _check_state of
and changing some logical in the code.

Change-Id: I4fa99e40d26d813399dbfe875f4bc9e4e5af9dcd

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-22 09:15:08.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Use dnf and python3 on platforms where these are default"

ansible 2.5.7[1] is not compatible with python 3.4 which is in CentOS7.

Collecting ansible==2.5.7 (from -r requirements.txt (line 3))
  Using cached https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/af/1e/edce5e4eb8d47716e3246185d08d626301efa433c4743ae47f9e3a5b9fef/ansible-2.5.7.tar.gz
ansible requires Python '>=2.6,!=3.0.*,!=3.1.*,!=3.2.*,!=3.3.*,!=3.4.*' but the running Python is 3.4.9

We should revert this on bump ansible version.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/blob/master/requirements.txt#L3

This reverts commit f2f6dcb209df33d063382f89a4a5c7620a3c91ac.

Change-Id: Ia920d3b10a91463dc522b959ae77864112dcd099
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Use dnf and python3 on platforms where these are default"

ansible 2.5.7[1] is not compatible with python 3.4 which is in CentOS7.

Collecting ansible==2.5.7 (from -r requirements.txt (line 3))
  Using cached https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/af/1e/edce5e4eb8d47716e3246185d08d626301efa433c4743ae47f9e3a5b9fef/ansible-2.5.7.tar.gz
ansible requires Python '>=2.6,!=3.0.*,!=3.1.*,!=3.2.*,!=3.3.*,!=3.4.*' but the running Python is 3.4.9

We should revert this on bump ansible version.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/blob/master/requirements.txt#L3

This reverts commit f2f6dcb209df33d063382f89a4a5c7620a3c91ac.

Change-Id: Ia920d3b10a91463dc522b959ae77864112dcd099

commit_message:
Document security considerations for detailed healthcheck

The detailed healthcheck output includes some potentially sensitive
information like stack traces of the service. This may be
unacceptable in some organizations and we should point it out in the
help for the option.

Change-Id: Ic10c29f39ef601e4c7873acb0d56e1ec8e4ebcb3

commit_message:
Added only_now parameter to action report-tenant-list

The API of getting rated tenant list is enhanced, if the new parameter
only_now is true, this API will return the immediate rated tenant list.
This patch modified the action report-tenant-list so that CLI also
support passing only_now parameter.

Change-Id: I97cd379c793e7d7f92b077aa2a799524c6c09e10
Depends-On: Ia963d22fdd2722b7dd5528cb5b782954f892e7ee

commit_message:
Fix unit tests after charms.openstack update

A recent commit to charms.openstack (78ce162e) added support for
using endpoints rather than relations. This caused an aodh unit
test to fail as it was looking for an endpoint. This change is a
simple fix for that.

Change-Id: I6b41352ccf0e422cd5e80a7a47f640164df3e14b

commit_message:
[OpenStack client] Change the time args format when total-get

For openstack client, the begin and end args format is timestamp
in total-get command, which is less convenient than date/time
format(YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS). So this patch make it easy what change
the time args format from timestamp to date/time.

Change-Id: I5ce9a40dd60a3e7b3a91042a20df10e4ab9499ba

commit_message:
Change the time format from timestamp to date/time when summary-get

The begin and end args format is timestamp in summary-get command,
which is less convenient than date/time format(YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS).
So this patch make it easy to use.

Refer to the patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/402089/

Change-Id: I03c111d4d38082d748f5974189237c8f638688ab

commit_message:
Set container_name as host_var in test inventory

The connection plugin no longer falls back on using the
inventory_hostname as the container_name. Set container_name as a host
var for each container in the test inventory.

Change-Id: I7a9343d29f853eba9b377855149d07a3d2865143

[{'created': '2018-10-18 15:47:26.000000000', 'message': "Support listening to multiple rabbit queues.

This change adds the ability to listen for events across multiple
rabbit queues. Nova cells v2 has a message broker per cell and
the charms already support having a separate message broker for
neutron, in both these topologies ceilometer needs the ability to
listen to multiple brokers.

To achieve this a new relation 'amqp-listener' has been introduced.
The existing 'amqp' relation should be used for the broker that
ceilometer listens to and publishes to. 'amqp-listener' should be
used for additional brokers that ceilometer just listens on.

Change-Id: Ifdade3f7814620f4cd4a1d35a584cbc099bb6d88
"}, {'created': '2018-10-19 07:31:00.000000000', 'message': "Support listening to multiple rabbit queues.

the charms already support having a separate message broker for
neutron, in both these topologies ceilometer needs the ability to
listen to multiple brokers.

To achieve this a new relation 'amqp-listener' has been introduced.
The existing 'amqp' relation should be used for the broker that
ceilometer listens to and publishes to. 'amqp-listener' should be
used for additional brokers that ceilometer just listens on.

Update functional tests to satisfy relation with
nova-cloud-controller.

Change-Id: Ifdade3f7814620f4cd4a1d35a584cbc099bb6d88
"}]
commit_message:
Support listening to multiple rabbit queues.

This change adds the ability to listen for events across multiple
rabbit queues. Nova cells v2 has a message broker per cell and
the charms already support having a separate message broker for
neutron, in both these topologies ceilometer needs the ability to
listen to multiple brokers.

To achieve this a new relation 'amqp-listener' has been introduced.
The existing 'amqp' relation should be used for the broker that
ceilometer listens to and publishes to. 'amqp-listener' should be
used for additional brokers that ceilometer just listens on.

Update functional tests to satisfy relation with
nova-cloud-controller.

Change-Id: Ifdade3f7814620f4cd4a1d35a584cbc099bb6d88

Change-Id: I7a9343d29f853eba9b377855149d07a3d2865143
(cherry picked from commit 66e6b8f69a6e4c5c0c3e992270eaf5b82cf356a0)

commit_message:
Set container_name as host_var in test inventory

The connection plugin no longer falls back on using the
inventory_hostname as the container_name. Set container_name as a host
var for each container in the test inventory.

Change-Id: I7a9343d29f853eba9b377855149d07a3d2865143
(cherry picked from commit 66e6b8f69a6e4c5c0c3e992270eaf5b82cf356a0)

commit_message:
Workflow uses parameter "viewModel.ready" to do the repetitive work.

In workflow module, every item in navigation used
'ng-show="viewModel.ready"' to determine whether it should
be display, it makes no sense to do so, and should replace
with the item parameter "step.ready" to control itself show
or hide.

Change-Id: Iadc5c90995022b2e0a13bcd46e4f2de64d1088b5
Closes-bug: #1797309

The exception handling for port, floating IP's or networks
is too broad. Add specific error handling and in a case when
the resource is not found do not raise a invalid message.

Change-Id: I98ee2ff816c03980645752eebb4e39d3ecd2e158
Closes-bug: #1796565

commit_message:
Do not raise invalid message when port does not exist

The exception handling for port, floating IP's or networks
is too broad. Add specific error handling and in a case when
the resource is not found do not raise a invalid message.

Change-Id: I98ee2ff816c03980645752eebb4e39d3ecd2e158
Closes-bug: #1796565

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-15 03:55:56.000000000', 'message': 'Clean up .gitignore references to personal tools

Developers run all sorts of different tools within Git repositories,
any of which can leave their own special trashfiles all over the
place. We can't every hope to catalog them all, so better to
recommend developers simply configure a global core.excludesfile to
filter the irrelevant files which tend to get created by their
personal choice of tools.

To this end, remove the long-standing sections for "Mr Developer"
and "Editors" since their mere existence here sends the signal that
we welcome (and have time to review) additions for any old tool
someone ever might happen to try. Also add a comment block
explaining this, for clarity.

We can, and should of course, continue to list files created by the
tools recommended by our workflow (test frameworks called from tox,
documentation and packaging builds, et cetera).

This change is a port of I1b41efac219fca44e2548fc36633724d0ecfc0cb
from the openstack-dev/oslo-cookiecutter repository.

Change-Id: I2c70b7b8c2e9d80bf9ddc90aec9a01ddc5745128
'}]
commit_message:
Clean up .gitignore references to personal tools

Developers run all sorts of different tools within Git repositories,
any of which can leave their own special trashfiles all over the
place. We can't every hope to catalog them all, so better to
recommend developers simply configure a global core.excludesfile to
filter the irrelevant files which tend to get created by their
personal choice of tools.

To this end, remove the long-standing sections for "Mr Developer"
and "Editors" since their mere existence here sends the signal that
we welcome (and have time to review) additions for any old tool
someone ever might happen to try. Also add a comment block
explaining this, for clarity.

We can, and should of course, continue to list files created by the
tools recommended by our workflow (test frameworks called from tox,
documentation and packaging builds, et cetera).

This change is a port of I1b41efac219fca44e2548fc36633724d0ecfc0cb
from the openstack-dev/oslo-cookiecutter repository.

Change-Id: I2c70b7b8c2e9d80bf9ddc90aec9a01ddc5745128

'}]
commit_message:
python3: Ensure ConfigOpts __iter__ uses list(d.keys())

d.keys() no longer returns a copy of the keys in Python 3.
This is part of PEP 3106.

Change-Id: Ie4897109c87d6dc2952c2eb35b83fe368fb31803
Closes-Bug: #1796163

Current logic didn't check if the nova_metadata_host is an IPv6 address
causing the proxy request to fail with an exception because the url is
not valid.

This patchs check if the nova_metadata_host is an IPv6 address and
create a valid url enclosing the IPv6 address with brackets

Closes-Bug: #1796593

Change-Id: Ibfebffcec2c8860237a1f151084de978a7863bd8
Signed-off-by: aojeagarcia <aojeagarcia@suse.com>

not valid.

create a valid url enclosing the IPv6 address with brackets

Change-Id: Ibfebffcec2c8860237a1f151084de978a7863bd8

commit_message:
Allow Ipv6 addresses for nova_metadata_host

Current logic didn't check if the nova_metadata_host is an IPv6 address
causing the proxy request to fail with an exception because the url is
not valid.

This patchs check if the nova_metadata_host is an IPv6 address and
create a valid url enclosing the IPv6 address with brackets

Closes-Bug: #1796593

Change-Id: Ibfebffcec2c8860237a1f151084de978a7863bd8
Signed-off-by: aojeagarcia <aojeagarcia@suse.com>
(cherry picked from commit 85588ad38e3a08137f4f7b4be98ce271064eb2f0)

commit_message:
heat-base: remove default policy rules

... the rule:context_is_admin is now managed in policy-in-code, in Heat:
https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/heat/tree/heat/policies/base.py#n25

Furthermore, the policy.json file management was removed with:
https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/11102/

Change-Id: Ibb2b7fa8750070fb338d04482a473a2bb3a2ea80
(cherry picked from commit c54b1b6169a8c4270068d14f7f9d270f2b563051)

commit_message:
The theme is openstackdocs

Fix path lookup, see
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/607298/12/openstackdocstheme/paths.py
and  openstackdocstheme/ext.py where we check for "openstackdocs" and
not "openstack".

Change-Id: I669b0368f27916b027205828cf3982657c64326d

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 8770, 'name': 'Ken Giusti', 'email': 'kgiusti@gmail.com', 'username': 'kgiusti'}, {'_account_id': 9796, 'name': 'ChangBo Guo', 'email': 'glongwave@gmail.com', 'username': 'gcb'}, {'_account_id': 15334, 'name': 'Stephen Finucane', 'display_name': 'stephenfin', 'email': 'stephenfin@redhat.com', 'username': 'sfinucan'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 28522, 'name': 'Hervé Beraud', 'email': 'herveberaud.pro@gmail.com', 'username': 'hberaud'}, {'_account_id': 29222, 'name': 'Natal Ngétal', 'email': 'hobbestigrou@erakis.eu', 'username': 'hobbestigrou'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2018-10-10 13:33:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 29222, 'date': '2018-10-10 13:44:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-10-10 14:21:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8770, 'date': '2018-10-10 15:19:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2018-10-10 17:31:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 8770, 'date': '2018-10-10 19:01:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: -Code-Review -Workflow

The pep8 error needs to be addressed.  It doesn't like the removal of the Apache headers.

Why are the apache headers being removed?"}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-10-11 13:39:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

> The pep8 error needs to be addressed.  It doesn't like the removal
 > of the Apache headers.
 > 
 > Why are the apache headers being removed?

My advice. These files were auto-generated so there shouldn't really be a copyright header. Guess we have to add it back in to keep the tool happy though"}, {'account_id': 8770, 'date': '2018-10-11 13:46:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Gotcha.  Putting them back is probably the easiest approach since flake8 analyzes all *.py files by default.

You could also maybe do it with the --exclude=<pattern> flake8 parameter - I haven't tried.

I'm good with either fix."}, {'account_id': 8770, 'date': '2018-10-11 13:53:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

The build-openstack-releasenotes test is failing for a different reason'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2018-10-12 08:20:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2018-10-12 08:47:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Gotcha.  Putting them back is probably the easiest approach since
 > flake8 analyzes all *.py files by default.
 > 
 > You could also maybe do it with the --exclude=<pattern> flake8
 > parameter - I haven't tried.
 > 
 > I'm good with either fix.

I've chosen to try to exclude python files inside releasenotes from flake8 tests"}, {'account_id': 29222, 'date': '2018-10-12 09:24:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-10-12 10:44:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-10-12 12:32:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

> > Gotcha.  Putting them back is probably the easiest approach since
 > > flake8 analyzes all *.py files by default.
 > >
 > > You could also maybe do it with the --exclude=<pattern> flake8
 > > parameter - I haven't tried.
 > >
 > > I'm good with either fix.
 > 
 > I've chosen to try to exclude python files inside releasenotes from
 > flake8 tests

But that's going to exclude it from all checks, not just this one check.

Please just put the license notice back. We can have the license without a copyright if someone objects to that, but even generated files can have a copyright because they're modified after they are generated."}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2018-10-12 15:06:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2018-10-12 15:07:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> > > Gotcha.  Putting them back is probably the easiest approach
 > since
 > > > flake8 analyzes all *.py files by default.
 > > >
 > > > You could also maybe do it with the --exclude=<pattern> flake8
 > > > parameter - I haven't tried.
 > > >
 > > > I'm good with either fix.
 > >
 > > I've chosen to try to exclude python files inside releasenotes
 > from
 > > flake8 tests
 > 
 > But that's going to exclude it from all checks, not just this one
 > check.
 > 
 > Please just put the license notice back. We can have the license
 > without a copyright if someone objects to that, but even generated
 > files can have a copyright because they're modified after they are
 > generated.

License restored"}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-10-12 15:19:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> > > Gotcha.  Putting them back is probably the easiest approach
 > since
 > > > flake8 analyzes all *.py files by default.
 > > >
 > > > You could also maybe do it with the --exclude=<pattern> flake8
 > > > parameter - I haven't tried.
 > > >
 > > > I'm good with either fix.
 > >
 > > I've chosen to try to exclude python files inside releasenotes
 > from
 > > flake8 tests
 > 
 > But that's going to exclude it from all checks, not just this one
 > check.

I thought that seemed fair, given that we do the exact same thing for doc. tbh, the fact we _don't_ exclude it seemed like an oversight

 > Please just put the license notice back. We can have the license
 > without a copyright if someone objects to that, but even generated
 > files can have a copyright because they're modified after they are
 > generated.

subject: Set a concurrency limit on ResourceChain
messages:
[{'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2018-10-04 15:15:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-10-04 19:16:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

I see this as a rough equivalent of I50182d39a8e5bd479afb6662d080ca15e0b83fe5 (even though that was proposed to solve a different problem), but for a single type of stack. Since I see no way to implement anything like that in convergence, I think this makes sense.

That also suggests that possibly we should make this a config option in future rather than a resource property, since the optimal value depends on e.g. the number of engine workers, not on how the user is using it. (Actually, I never thought of this before, but don't we know the total number of workers across the cluster from the service management stuff in the DB?)"}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-10-05 03:00:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Set a concurrency limit on ResourceChain

This adds a limit to the number of resources that ResourceChain creates
in parallel. It reduces memory usage drastically when ResourceChain
contains lots of resources. We use the number of active services, which
seems to give a reasonable balance between performance and memory
consumption.

Story: #2003975
Task: #26917
Change-Id: Id20fb89813b32927298b3a7c0abe23da710b04d1

I suspect we need to add some support to tempestconf before proceeding.'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2018-10-10 22:28:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> I suspect we need to add some support to tempestconf before proceeding.

Sorry, I am out-of-loop around why we need tempestconf support right away, Is something broken with the current approach of tempest config within the feature sets? Is it cleaner to do this with tempestconf? If yes, can we keep running these tests until we land that code? :)'}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2018-10-11 06:40:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> > I suspect we need to add some support to tempestconf before
 > proceeding.
 > 
 > Sorry, I am out-of-loop around why we need tempestconf support
 > right away, Is something broken with the current approach of
 > tempest config within the feature sets? Is it cleaner to do this
 > with tempestconf? If yes, can we keep running these tests until we
 > land that code? :)

Currently we are storing the tempest config params in featureset files:
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/tree/config/general_config/featureset008.yml#n71
These config needs to be moved to python-tempestconf project where it can be automatically generated when manila or sahara tests are enabled based on the environment and can be used any end user who are using python-tempestconf to generate manila/sahara tempest tests.which is what Luigi is suggesting.
For other services, python-tempestconf [http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/python-tempestconf]has already support for the same.
Here is one of the example on how to add a new service support in python-tempestconf: https://review.openstack.org/571177'}, {'account_id': 8367, 'date': '2018-10-11 11:41:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

I'm seeing only manila_tempest_tests.tests.api.test_shares.SharesCephFSTest test, is that correct?"}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-10-11 11:49:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Also sahara_tempest_plugin.tests.api.test_data_sources.DataSourceTest in scenario003.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-10-11 13:07:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

After rechecking the code of python-tempestconf, few notes:
- python-tempestconf can detect whether sahara and manila are active or not for now; even if it needs some patches when the discovery will not rely on an internal the list of services, that part should work;
- it looks like a specific issue with that featureset (020), but the solution should have been: add the specific manila/sahara configuration to that job, instead of blacklisting the tests.'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2018-10-11 14:20:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Adding my +1 but I'm not sure I really understand why these were being skipped in the first place."}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2018-10-11 15:43:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2018-10-11 15:44:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Un-skip manila and sahara tests on master and Rocky

Iaf70abbb9ca6a18f081ca715b9f7f165a0c0600c introduced
a change to skip tests belonging to various tempest plugins.
Manila's tempest tests are configured and enabled on
master and stable/rocky in Featuresets 008 [1] and 019 [2].
Sahara's tempest tests are configured and enabled on
master and stable/rocky in Featuresets 007 [3] and 018 [4].

Remove these two tempest plugins from the skip list. They
are very much supported in TripleO and they are adequately
configured with the tempest_config options in the featuresets
referenced.

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/tree/config/general_config/featureset008.yml
[2] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/tree/config/general_config/featureset019.yml
[3] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/tree/config/general_config/featureset007.yml
[4] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/tree/config/general_config/featureset018.yml

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/609741/
Change-Id: I4656f3d70ec523160b489f8131e6cc3971bd85b8

commit_message:
Improve services management in client

This patch add/update cmd as follows:
    cloudkitty info-service-list
       list add services
    cloudkitty info-service-get -n compute
       show compute service detail info
    cloudkitty info-service-enable -n compute
       enable compute service
    cloudkitty info-service-disable -n compute
       disable compute service

Depends-On: a208bcab09ba0fe7567d9d89c8cb009218187cf0

- gate-cloudkitty-specs-docs-ubuntu-xenial http://docs-draft.openstack.org/42/429342/2/check/gate-cloudkitty-specs-docs-ubuntu-xenial/32dde06//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 2m 27s'}, {'account_id': 23173, 'date': '2017-02-13 17:21:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hi @all

By doing this, we definitively lose the possibility to use several collectors: my patch on improving user experience actually limits collector info retrieval to the one set in the configuration file. But you can still use several processors with different processors. By getting services from the db, we definitively lose this possibility. 

We may think of a more general refactoring for service improvement with
the following features:

- support multiple collectors with API activation
- support service activation per collector
- support for multiple collectors in Orchestrator. To use multiple processors for dedicated collectors, we may provided a list of collectors to use if activated'}, {'account_id': 23060, 'date': '2018-10-23 09:38:29.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

No reply since over a year, closing. But many thanks for your work anyway!'}]

commit_message:
Add puppet-neutron-tripleo-standalone job

* It overrrides the tripleo-standalone featureset override to run Neutron
  specific tempest tests.

* It will help to detect the puppet-neutron tempest specific issues
  early in gates.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/609666

Change-Id: Idf58967c3e394f71e886346f224087254be0c118

commit_message:
Isolate repo wheel builds from pip.conf

The repo wheel builds need to be isolated from pip.conf
to ensure that new wheels can be built whenever doing an
upgrade.

Change-Id: Iba22f5a11af858b52f006494b30002d34e5aa4f6

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-19 08:35:49.000000000', 'message': "Add a post-root.d phase

While trying to get docker image pre-caching to work we couldn't get a
docker daeomon to run within the chrooted environment. However we got
docker running with the help of bwrap outside of the chrooted
environment. The only option so far for this is the block-device.d
phase. But this has the problem that it runs after the image size has
been calculated. This leads to broken builds if the docker images
being pulled are big.

This can be solved by adding a post-root.d phase that runs outside the
chroot but before the image size calculation.

Change-Id: I36c2a81e2d9f5069f18ce5b0d52c5f1c7212c3ae
"}]
commit_message:
Add a post-root.d phase

While trying to get docker image pre-caching to work we couldn't get a
docker daeomon to run within the chrooted environment. However we got
docker running with the help of bwrap outside of the chrooted
environment. The only option so far for this is the block-device.d
phase. But this has the problem that it runs after the image size has
been calculated. This leads to broken builds if the docker images
being pulled are big.

This can be solved by adding a post-root.d phase that runs outside the
chroot but before the image size calculation.

Change-Id: I36c2a81e2d9f5069f18ce5b0d52c5f1c7212c3ae

and the cache is updated, cleaned and a dist-upgrade is done there.

[{'created': '2018-10-22 08:30:05.000000000', 'message': 'Fix cinder_api_apache error during upgrade.

In I35c8d9985df21b3084fba558687e1f408e5a0878 we removed the
cinder_api_apache from step 2.  This cause the upgrade to fail as the
next task is using that variable.

Resolve-Bug: #1799166
'}]
commit_message:
Fix cinder_api_apache error during upgrade.

In I35c8d9985df21b3084fba558687e1f408e5a0878 we removed the
cinder_api_apache from step 2.  This cause the upgrade to fail as the
next task is using that variable.

Converting it to a fact in step 0 so that we can call it later.

Change-Id: I55058fd6288eec87fd1cd028b4a684b9472496cb
Resolve-Bug: #1799166

"Fetch all security groups for non-admin user", the following check
is not correct, it can't check "all created Security Groups are
present in fetched list", but can only check that "no other user's
Security Groups can be retrieved by non-admin user."
This is to fix the check statements.

Change-Id: I4781a3450385a66df53c437791ac6b107d8efe7e
'}]
commit_message:
Fix assert logic in test_list_security_groups_list_all_tenants_filter

In test_list_security_groups_list_all_tenants_filter, when testing
"Fetch all security groups for non-admin user", the following check
is not correct, it can't check "all created Security Groups are
present in fetched list", but can only check that "no other user's
Security Groups can be retrieved by non-admin user."
This is to fix the check statements.

Change-Id: I4781a3450385a66df53c437791ac6b107d8efe7e

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-22 15:29:12.000000000', 'message': 'Fix bug in dnsmasq config

When starting to use dnsmasq version 2.78, we were getting the error:

bad dhcp-range

when using:
dhcp-range=192.168.122.1,192.168.122.254,static,255.255.255.0,12h

That configuration is apparently wrong as explained in this mail:

http://lists.thekelleys.org.uk/pipermail/dnsmasq-discuss/2016q1/010386.html

The second IP address should be removed because we are using static ip
addresses

Change-Id: I6e9d36ee8c9dc487bbd86062981667c35a0fe128
Signed-off-by: Manuel Buil <mbuil@suse.com>
(cherry picked from commit 0f605cd723a68e2c2bb9b30a15a08e5aba777bd5)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix bug in dnsmasq config

When starting to use dnsmasq version 2.78, we were getting the error:

bad dhcp-range

when using:
dhcp-range=192.168.122.1,192.168.122.254,static,255.255.255.0,12h

That configuration is apparently wrong as explained in this mail:

http://lists.thekelleys.org.uk/pipermail/dnsmasq-discuss/2016q1/010386.html

The second IP address should be removed because we are using static ip
addresses

Change-Id: I6e9d36ee8c9dc487bbd86062981667c35a0fe128
Signed-off-by: Manuel Buil <mbuil@suse.com>
(cherry picked from commit 0f605cd723a68e2c2bb9b30a15a08e5aba777bd5)
