commit_message:
update "auth_url" in documents

As keystone has removed identity API v2.0,so update the "auth_url" in docs.
With the removal of the v2 API, keystone can be run on the same port for
all interfaces.for more information,see [0][1]
[0]https://docs.openstack.org/keystone/latest/install/keystone-install-rdo.html#install-and-configure-components
[1]https://docs.openstack.org/keystone/latest/contributor/http-api.html

Change-Id: Ic16e366e59232bee4bc7ce2d9e16602dd74f0bd2

commit_message:
Refactor API code for checking microversions

Copy-paste, copy-paste everywhere! This change reduces the number of
places where essentially the same checks were applied in the API code.

Change-Id: I0fe6a6bf8757f3fa99308f66f082f899680ad33c

commit_message:
Add puppet-keystone-tripleo-standalone job

* It overrrides the tripleo-standalone featureset override
  to run Identity specific tempest tests and install
  keystone tempest plugin.
* It will help to detect the puppet-keystone tempest specific
  issues early in gates.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/609666

commit_message:
Update ansible to latest stable 2.6.x

With this, the requirement for the os_* modules
changes from shade to openstacksdk. The 'ansible-next'
job is also updated to test stable-2.7.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/611765
Change-Id: If32f88592caa849c3c7c9701d4803530d9e549ed
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-21 14:39:48.000000000', 'message': "Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: I1933094dbda34f8a292e7e2484166383df44f8c6
"}]
commit_message:
Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: I1933094dbda34f8a292e7e2484166383df44f8c6

commit_message:
Ensure that the --template-file option is passed to the kolla builder

This patch ensures that the file path passed into the openstack
overcloud container prepare command using --template-file is correctly
passed through to the kolla_builder container image prepare function.

Change-Id: I5df6926e0b9417f746e47cce3ccb9218dfa13a80
Closes-Bug: #1791039

subject: Follow the new PTI for document build
messages:
[{'account_id': 9414, 'date': '2018-03-02 00:52:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-03-08 10:51:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-03-12 19:45:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

There appears to be a legitimate warning in this repo that needs to be fixed first:

Warning, treated as error:
/opt/stack/oslo.cache/doc/source/reference/index.rst:7:toctree contains reference to nonexisting document u'reference/api/modules'

I'm a little concerned that the docs job is passing anyway. :-/"}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-03-21 10:06:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

> There appears to be a legitimate warning in this repo that needs to
 > be fixed first:
 > 
 > Warning, treated as error:
 > /opt/stack/oslo.cache/doc/source/reference/index.rst:7:toctree
 > contains reference to nonexisting document u'reference/api/modules'
 > 
 > I'm a little concerned that the docs job is passing anyway. :-/

Damn, I've spotted this on a couple of projects now. This failure occurs because the project uses pbr's autodoc feature [1]. We're going to need to migrate away from this to get this working. You can confirm this behavior in the gate by removing the 'build_sphinx' section from the 'setup.cfg' file. Alternatively, you can run this locally, as you've done. We should revert the previous "Migrate to PTI" patch until this is resolved.

commit_message:
Update min tox version to 2.0

The commands used by constraints need at least tox 2.0.  Update to
reflect reality, which should help with local running of constraints
targets.

Change-Id: Id0e9d5aceeb12ceba176d65d33980f775878c809

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-14 11:24:52.000000000', 'message': "Use the compute kit + horizon for all distros

The AIO is useful for demonstrating OpenStack, and for testing
it. The primary services required for demonstration are the
Compute Kit [1] and Horizon. This also serves us well for test
purposes. Rather than having a mix between the AIO and 'Base Kit'
in the jobs, we converge them all to the 'AIO' set and reduce
the set to only include these services.

For the 'metal' jobs we leave horizon out. At this time, horizon
binds to all listening addresses and conflicts with nginx. This
will need to be fixed in a subsequent patch.

We also switch all Xenial jobs to Bionic, and sort the services
in each scenario alphabetically to make them easier to scan when
comparing them. All the commented jobs in the zuul templates/project
are removed - they're just noise which makes reviewing things
confusing.

The OpenSUSE jobs are all set to non-voting for now due to
issues with the mirror. The bionic/ceph jobs are set to non-voting
for now while an issue with RGW is worked out that causes a segfault
when running tempest against it on bionic.

Change-Id: I67cfaaf1e0bbffbe4f00a5f145f7e410b80c3eb0
(cherry picked from commit 8d25033f7907906ed7a2434b70e7c501cb4a290a)
"}, {'created': '2018-10-18 10:15:48.000000000', 'message': "Use the compute kit + horizon for all distros

it. The primary services required for demonstration are the

Change-Id: I67cfaaf1e0bbffbe4f00a5f145f7e410b80c3eb0
(cherry picked from commit 8d25033f7907906ed7a2434b70e7c501cb4a290a)
"}]
commit_message:
Use the compute kit + horizon for all distros

The AIO is useful for demonstrating OpenStack, and for testing
it. The primary services required for demonstration are the
Compute Kit [1] and Horizon. This also serves us well for test
purposes. Rather than having a mix between the AIO and 'Base Kit'
in the jobs, we converge them all to the 'AIO' set and reduce
the set to only include these services.

For the 'metal' jobs we leave horizon out. At this time, horizon
binds to all listening addresses and conflicts with nginx. This
will need to be fixed in a subsequent patch.

We sort the services in each scenario alphabetically to make them
easier to scan when comparing them. All the commented jobs in the
zuul templates/project are removed - they're just noise which makes
reviewing things confusing.

The OpenSUSE jobs are all set to non-voting for now due to
issues with the mirror. The bionic/ceph jobs are set to non-voting
for now while an issue with RGW is worked out that causes a segfault
when running tempest against it on bionic.

Change-Id: I67cfaaf1e0bbffbe4f00a5f145f7e410b80c3eb0
(cherry picked from commit 8d25033f7907906ed7a2434b70e7c501cb4a290a)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-18 15:54:36.000000000', 'message': 'Fix bug in dnsmasq config

When starting to use dnsmasq version 2.78, we were getting the error:

bad dhcp-range

when using:
dhcp-range=192.168.122.1,192.168.122.254,static,255.255.255.0,12h

That configuration is apparently wrong as explained in this mail:

http://lists.thekelleys.org.uk/pipermail/dnsmasq-discuss/2016q1/010386.html

The second IP address should be removed because we are using static ip
addresses

Change-Id: I6e9d36ee8c9dc487bbd86062981667c35a0fe128
Signed-off-by: Manuel Buil <mbuil@suse.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix bug in dnsmasq config

When starting to use dnsmasq version 2.78, we were getting the error:

bad dhcp-range

when using:
dhcp-range=192.168.122.1,192.168.122.254,static,255.255.255.0,12h

That configuration is apparently wrong as explained in this mail:

http://lists.thekelleys.org.uk/pipermail/dnsmasq-discuss/2016q1/010386.html

The second IP address should be removed because we are using static ip
addresses

Change-Id: I6e9d36ee8c9dc487bbd86062981667c35a0fe128
Signed-off-by: Manuel Buil <mbuil@suse.com>

[{'created': '2018-10-03 07:55:37.000000000', 'message': 'rabbitmq_upgrade_check: Do not complain for upgrades on distro packages

Distributions normally provide one version of rabbitmq. Comparing this
version against the one provided by packagecloud makes little sense
unless the user explicitly requested to install the package from an
external source. As such, we should not complain when distribution
packages are used.

Change-Id: If56873908776ce7a6908f6c4d4aef096d084859f
(cherry picked from commit 75ba65c1008106a90cffe6d080fe02459f6c2ae4)
'}]
commit_message:
rabbitmq_upgrade_check: Do not complain for upgrades on distro packages

Distributions normally provide one version of rabbitmq. Comparing this
version against the one provided by packagecloud makes little sense
unless the user explicitly requested to install the package from an
external source. As such, we should not complain when distribution
packages are used.

Change-Id: If56873908776ce7a6908f6c4d4aef096d084859f
(cherry picked from commit 75ba65c1008106a90cffe6d080fe02459f6c2ae4)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-27 08:48:47.000000000', 'message': 'Add version discovery information to the /v1 endpoint

Currently we do not provide enough information for keystoneauth
to work on. This makes version discovery impossible e.g. in a standalone
case when the versioned endpoint is supplied by a user.

This change adds the required versioning information based on the actual
keystoneauth implementation and the in-progress API SIG specification:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/459710/

Note that this change is not microversioned, as it is used to discover
available microversions for the versioned endpoint.

Change-Id: Ibb1e8a1c8973a4742b7ba508dc84de577cb967c9
Story: #2003567
Task: #24859
'}]
commit_message:
Add version discovery information to the /v1 endpoint

Currently we do not provide enough information for keystoneauth
to work on. This makes version discovery impossible e.g. in a standalone
case when the versioned endpoint is supplied by a user.

This change adds the required versioning information based on the actual
keystoneauth implementation and the in-progress API SIG specification:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/459710/

Note that this change is not microversioned, as it is used to discover
available microversions for the versioned endpoint.

Change-Id: Ibb1e8a1c8973a4742b7ba508dc84de577cb967c9
Story: #2003567
Task: #24859

commit_message:
Don't start task managers passed in to Connection

If someone (such as our friend nodepool) creates and passes in a
TaskManager, it should be assumed that the calling context controls the
lifecycle of that TaskManager. In that case, don't run start() on it.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/612168
Change-Id: I0ac5dc428250158471cb64d5b1601cabbb4deb86

commit_message:
migration: workaround ovs-vswitchd bug during migration

Because of [1], when a controller is disconnected and you add a new
port to an Open vSwitch bridge ovs-vswitchd crashes.

There's a patch upstream, but this will allow us to continue
without

Closes-Bug: #1798377

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1640045

Change-Id: Id47086d50167fd417d0be67b720f63be62e3ff35

commit_message:
Members should not be created without Subnets

OVN requires the subnet information while creating members,
so that it can track the references to a network. Without the
subnet, members should not be created when OVN is the provider driver
for Octavia

Change-Id: I7f9ef5ae53f64279e70d83510ec51f24cd264fc2

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-29 23:53:14.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I4cf01eedf29fd9406722f32838920f2af1704a08
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I4cf01eedf29fd9406722f32838920f2af1704a08
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

Change-Id: I72844a944cfea5380de25dbd7cf7231c8d39f4ec

commit_message:
Remove dependency to OSH repo

This removes yet another time the dependency towards OSH repo.
With each repository independant, we can later introduce abstract
jobs that will be re-usable but with a clean dependency map: only
bring jobs from one single location, openstack-helm-infra.

Change-Id: I72844a944cfea5380de25dbd7cf7231c8d39f4ec

commit_message:
Adds doc8 check to pep8

This patch adds doc8 check for .rst files to pep8.
Files that fail doc8 check are also fixed.

Change-Id: Ib8556b6eac0fb5a9bd3b7f8dcf000ab1b23e23bc

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-18 06:53:42.000000000', 'message': 'Do not check account unlock if user_lockout_duration is too long

In test_user_account_lockout, we will check "If we wait the required
time, the user account will be unlocked", but if user_lockout_duration
is too long, it's not suitable to check account unlock after sleeping
for so long a time.
Maybe to sleep 10 seconds is the most acceptable.

Change-Id: Ie8fc407633708066e60322f73cdfed1a0a0dbd20
'}, {'created': '2018-10-19 03:01:42.000000000', 'message': 'Do not check account unlock if user_lockout_duration is too long

In test_user_account_lockout, we will check "If we wait the required
time, the user account will be unlocked", but if user_lockout_duration
is too long, it's not suitable to check account unlock after sleeping
for so long a time. So if we want to test this feature, we'd better
set a smaller value for user_lockout_duration, otherwise we will skip
the testcase.
Maybe to sleep 60 seconds is the most acceptable.

Change-Id: Ie8fc407633708066e60322f73cdfed1a0a0dbd20
'}, {'created': '2018-10-19 09:14:09.000000000', 'message': 'Do not check account unlock if lockout config is 0

In test_user_account_lockout, if both CONF.identity.user_lockout_failure
_attempts and CONF.identity.user_lockout_duration are set to 0, the
testcase should be skipped.

Change-Id: Ie8fc407633708066e60322f73cdfed1a0a0dbd20
'}]
commit_message:
Do not check account unlock if lockout config is 0

In test_user_account_lockout, if both CONF.identity.user_lockout_failure
_attempts and CONF.identity.user_lockout_duration are set to 0, the
testcase should be skipped.

Change-Id: Ie8fc407633708066e60322f73cdfed1a0a0dbd20

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-16 08:17:50.000000000', 'message': 'playbooks: Convert venv_python_path to proper role

The venv_python_path tasks were in the roles directroy but we were
including it as a normal file with a list of tasks so it was not really
an Ansible role. This does not work well when we use the Bifrost roles
outside of bifrost since Ansible does not know where to find this file
for inclusion. Our best chance is to convert it to a simple role which
can be statically imported.

Change-Id: I82fdfe48f9f2eb631165ab630157bc378ddc631d

including it as a normal file with a list of tasks so it was not really

commit_message:
playbooks: Convert venv_python_path to proper role

The venv_python_path tasks were in the roles directroy but we were
including it as a normal file with a list of tasks so it was not really
an Ansible role. This does not work well when we use the Bifrost roles
outside of bifrost since Ansible does not know where to find this file
for inclusion. Our best chance is to convert it to a simple role which
can be statically imported.

Change-Id: I82fdfe48f9f2eb631165ab630157bc378ddc631d

Add workaround to pin pip to 18.0

The default recipe does not work with the latest version of pip. The
workaround is to override to 18.0

Change-Id: If245c3c51930beba151ed8a42cec15131ea28098
(cherry picked from commit 97af7feec5b961f90d4895aa7ca0021ac53bd70d)

commit_message:
doc: restructure the image building documentation

Main goal: consolidate the information about image
building under the same documentation page, and move
plugin-specific details inside plugin pages.
No plugin-specific information should live outside
those pages.

More details:
- move the detailed documentation about sahara-image-pack
  from the contributor guide to the new dedicated page
  in the user manual;
- remove the vanilla and cdh pages which describes building
  images with sahara-image-create, and move the common
  information to new sahara-image-create page
  in the user manual;
- add the matrix of supported plugin versions and
  supported building technology for each plugin inside
  the respective <plugin>-plugin.rst;
- add the redirects for the removed pages (only for master
  and rocky, where this change should be backported).
- remove few details not really needed (e.g. how to convert
  to VMDK images, location of cloud-init packages, etc,
  which do not really belong here).

Change-Id: I8398a7ad625276d8f11d743688ba71902a7e1adc

commit_message:
Update docs conf.py for openstackdocstheme change

A Starlingx patch[1] changed the signature for some openstackdocstheme
methods which is causing Octavia docs to not build.

This patch updates the octavia docs configuration for the new
openstackdocstheme.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/607298

Change-Id: Id09ab3b78291c28e116f1f4ffb8836eac0537d94

commit_message:
Add reflection of RpcPort to health checks

This patch passes RpcPort parameter value to container health check
scripts, which are based on verifying if service is connected to RabbitMQ.

Change-Id: If63f136b5173bb9a94572ea5062a188469c2c782
Closes-Bug: #1782369
(cherry picked from commit 7351b3cc204e9fed8543778bf9d36494b95b3af9)

commit_message:
Stop relying on old legacy sub_nodes_private

Use inventory variables in CI code for subnodes and
primray node.

Change-Id: I902ce149e72b616e5e18facc17e4371aafcd373a

commit_message:
Ignore doc build path

If you build the docs with `tox -edocs` and then run `tox -epep8`,
it will always fail because it checks the build output from the
docs. This change ignores the build folder.

Trivial-Fix
Change-Id: Ie7c53b517b7cfff1d317cad014371c94c6212eac

commit_message:
Restore OpenSUSE voting jobs

In https://review.openstack.org/609329 we had to disable
voting for the OpenSUSE jobs due to mirror issues. This
patch restores the jobs to voting again.

Change-Id: If2091627b3518d1e16127ff9706ad28bc3ce1502

commit_message:
Fix tests in test_public_ip.py

Looks like all the tests in test_public_ip.py were fundametaly broken
because of mocking *all* the methods of FipPubIpDriver causing the
tested method to not be exectued. This commit fixes that.

Closes-Bug: 1798782

Change-Id: I6286db8d70a111efc88292b47c631d0d81108cd2

commit_message:
Run NetworkDeployment as async task

This commit adds special handling of the NetworkDeployment such that it
will be run as an async task with ansible. This should prevent any
issues where the network configuration causes the ssh connection to drop
and the ansible task to either be unnecessarily retried or failed.

Also added are three variables that can be used to control the async
behavior:

async_deployment: boolean which will toggle running all deployments in
                  async mode.
async_timeout:    timeout in seconds to wait for async tasks
async_poll:       interval in seconds to check async task status

These variables can only be set if running the config-download process
manually, however a future patch could wire them up to Heat parameters.

Change-Id: If1f35980a98a9015ca65f2c6a3e4db04725f1c10
Closes-Bug: #1792343

commit_message:
Improve pep8 checking along with hacking

This change will help to check the function _() is
used but not imported. And the gates will check this missing
in the next time.

Change-Id: Ic1dd25e99c3db9fc8782a5f0977679978e274191

commit_message:
releasenotes: oslo-messaging-separate-backends add project name

Without this patch, the release notes published at
https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/openstack-ansible/rocky.html contains
the same line multiple times which is not very clear.

[...]
    Support separate oslo.messaging services for RPC and Notifications
    to enable operation of separate and different messaging backend servers.

    Support separate oslo.messaging services for RPC and Notifications
    to enable operation of separate and different messaging backend servers.
[...]

Change-Id: I0ed1a43670d97f2e2215d04c641f7bd4cfbe4f44
(cherry picked from commit 161fb3cd8495e71748687b1f6294100c7f310122)

Before I review any further on this, what's the reason for retaining the old, CLI-based method rather than moving everything to the native approach? I'm not sure what "backwards compatibility" means in this context'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2017-10-03 09:14:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

@Stephen, I'm trying to make transition as smooth as possible. First, I'm creating an abstract API for any possible OVSDB implementation. Then I'm migrating the existing code. So far, the code should work the same.

The next step [1] is to use the native library using the API defined in this patch. You can choose any one of these implementations just using a config parameter. To remove the CLI one is as easy as deprecate it first and then remove the code.

This is the long way but the safest.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/482226/"}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2017-11-02 09:22:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Patch Set 15 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2017-11-06 08:39:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17: Published edit on patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2017-11-13 08:57:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 18.'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2017-12-01 20:36:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 19.'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2017-12-02 10:50:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20: Published edit on patch set 19.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2017-12-06 01:02:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-06-22 16:06:43.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Add abstract OVSDB API

Abstract all existing ``ovs-vsctl`` calls to an abstract OVSDB API.
This will allow the future addition of a native OVSDB protocol
implementation of the API without breaking backwards compatibility.

NOTE: still in progress. Uploaded just for discussion. Tests pending.

Partial-Bug: #1666917
Change-Id: I9ec36be390d713a928a673191008612f3fddad8f

commit_message:
Add abstract OVSDB API

Abstract all existing 'ovs-vsctl' calls to an abstract OVSDB API.
This will allow the future addition of a native OVSDB protocol
implementation of the API without breaking backwards compatibility.

Partial-Bug: #1666917
Change-Id: I9ec36be390d713a928a673191008612f3fddad8f

commit_message:
Update min tox version to 2.0

The commands used by constraints need at least tox 2.0.  Update to
reflect reality, which should help with local running of constraints
targets.

Change-Id: I0ff800d84949f1a02b083b4fcf16e9b82f0d9e57

commit_message:
use payloads for NETWORK BEFORE_DELETE events

This patch switches callbacks to use payloads for BEFORE_DELETE events
of NETWORK resources. To do so the DBEventPayload payload class is used
to encapsulate event data and the respective callback handles are
updated to use the payload kwarg.

NeutronLibImpact

commit_message:
Revert "file_perms: Skip rpm verification step for Leap 15"

This reverts commit 75e8b0f02a735aaeb8c53ee03e328bd446016bc7.

The openSUSE bug has been fixed so this workaround is not needed
anymore.

Change-Id: I7d8a93332d0ec925d97b64fc1052b1c3d621e066

commit_message:
Introduce Port resource request extension

The resources needed by a port are expressed to nova via
resource_request extending the port.
If the port requested by nova boot has resource_request attribute, that
means that placement must enforce the minimum bandwidth requirements.

Change-Id: I82afa56fa784fc43fefd1ce494bff649f51ad1c8
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/584903
Partial-Bug: #1578989
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/502306 (nova spec)
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/508149 (neutron spec)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-13 12:51:13.000000000', 'message': "Correct edp-spark workflow dir permission

edp spark engine places job binary and workflow
dir on the /tmp directory. The owner of these
files and dor are image user. Whereas spark job
is normally fired as spark user who doesn't
have access to these files. As a result spark
job fail with permission denied error as
shown in the logs provided in story.

This behaviour is visible when the image is
hardened which  changes the default file
permission that are stored in /tmp.

This fix proposes to explicitly provide
required access level on the files
under /tmp that are needed by spark job.

Change-Id: I23dffa7b0b8b44ba2deeb855839cb078d1e44852
Story: #2003414
Task: #24558
"}]
commit_message:
Correct edp-spark workflow dir permission

edp spark engine places job binary and workflow
dir on the /tmp directory. The owner of these
files and dor are image user. Whereas spark job
is normally fired as spark user who doesn't
have access to these files. As a result spark
job fail with permission denied error as
shown in the logs provided in story.

This behaviour is visible when the image is
hardened which  changes the default file
permission that are stored in /tmp.

This fix proposes to explicitly provide
required access level on the files
under /tmp that are needed by spark job.

Change-Id: I23dffa7b0b8b44ba2deeb855839cb078d1e44852
Story: #2003414
Task: #24558

@Slawek, one question: maybe this changed last year, but if a network backend does not support a rule (e.g.: LB min ingress), the driver shouldn't contain this rule. Am I correct?"}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-09-26 12:33:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> @Slawek, one question: maybe this changed last year, but if a
 > network backend does not support a rule (e.g.: LB min ingress), the
 > driver shouldn't contain this rule. Am I correct?

Hi, not exactly. We decided some time ago that this specific rule will be available even if backend driver don't support that. It is like that because in some cases (like e.g. private cloud) it may be enough to ensure minimum bandwidth on scheduler level, even if backend driver can't enforce it."}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2018-09-26 13:14:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> > @Slawek, one question: maybe this changed last year, but if a
 > > network backend does not support a rule (e.g.: LB min ingress),
 > the
 > > driver shouldn't contain this rule. Am I correct?
 > 
 > Hi, not exactly. We decided some time ago that this specific rule
 > will be available even if backend driver don't support that. It is
 > like that because in some cases (like e.g. private cloud) it may be
 > enough to ensure minimum bandwidth on scheduler level, even if
 > backend driver can't enforce it.

Yes, now I remember this conversation a long time ago. Enable QoS minimum-bandwidth rule for all supported backends (ovs, sriov
linuxbridge) for both ingress and egress directions.
Add qos-bw-limit-direction as supported extension to qos-plugin, and
add create/delete/update_minimum_bandwidth and
delete_minimum_bandwidth_ingress empty methods to sriov/ovs/linuxbridge
extension drivers.

TODO:
- unit tests
- documentation

commit_message:
Enable ingress direction for min_bw rule

Enable QoS minimum-bandwidth rule for ovs and sriov backends for both
ingress and egress directions.
Add qos-bw-limit-direction as supported extension to qos-plugin, and
add create/delete/update_minimum_bandwidth and
delete_minimum_bandwidth_ingress empty methods to sriov/ovs/linuxbridge
extension drivers.

Change-Id: I6eb21ccf0400ea9adae90ff0bf97e08cdb09b8eb
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/609368
Partial-Bug: #1578989
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/502306 (nova spec)
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/508149 (neutron spec)

commit_message:
Adjust templating for upgrade scripts.

Cosmetic change to align options within upgrade scripts. E.g:
  openstack overcloud  upgrade converge \
    --overcloud-ssh-user tripleo-admin \
        --templates /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates \
      --stack overcloud \
        --disable-validations \
    --deployed-server ...

To this:
  openstack overcloud  upgrade converge \
      --overcloud-ssh-user tripleo-admin \
      --templates /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates \
      --stack overcloud \
      --disable-validations \
      --deployed-server ...

Change-Id: Id4944a53a3e29c6a4c40aeec49746bce98c4880f

commit_message:
Remove test_rule_create_fail_for_direction_ingress

When the API extension qos-bw-minimum-ingress will be on master (see:
https://review.openstack.org/584927) the test
neutron_tempest_plugin.api.test_qos.QosMinimumBandwidthRuleTestJSON.
test_rule_create_fail_for_direction_ingress is useless, so it can be
removed from master, and to keep the coverage for stable branches there
should be fullstack test: I6ee08d43aed60a7dd2d3281deaccfac2f3712b33

Change-Id: Ie04d53817c1f28b4756b1cc308203dc77dd2a19c
Partial-Bug: #1578989
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/502306 (nova spec)
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/508149 (neutron spec)

commit_message:
Fix next link in get resource list rest API

Fix the issue where `next` link in the response of the REST API, when
used with pagination, gets corrupted and makes it unusable. After this
fix, next link should be readily usable.

Change-Id: Idf45a59e0b07d8306cc82391679fe30a9cd2f0c1
Closes-Bug: #1793344
(cherry picked from commit 08ba20c8d217713a140b90240176bc7959125b62)

commit_message:
Fix rendering of notes and code in major upgrade docs

Some notes and code in major upgrade docs rendered differently than in
the rest of the TripleO docs, it was due to indentation of the blocks
putting them inside a blockquote tag, which messed up the applied CSS
rules.

Change-Id: I3fe17c24115f294c70af145b5e93802f3674f74e

subject: wheel-build : temporary pip with checksum output
messages:
[{'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-10-22 05:11:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-10-22 05:27:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I have placed corrupt and good wheels and hexdumps (built by hand on a infra Bionic node, using the same environment as what would happen in the gate) in 

 http://people.redhat.com/~iwienand/pip-corrupt/

What is interesting is that "7z" says on the corrupt wheel

 WARNINGS:
 There are data after the end of archive

And if you extract the corrupt wheel with "7z x -t#" you get the following

 -rw-rw-r--. 1 iwienand iwienand  88761 Oct 22 12:49 1.zip
 -rw-rw-r--. 1 iwienand iwienand     22 Oct 22 12:49 2

where "2" appears to be an empty zip archive

 [iwienand@fedora19 pip-corrupt]$ hexdump -C 2 
 00000000  50 4b 05 06 00 00 00 00  3f 00 3f 00 d1 13 00 00  |PK......?.?.....|
 00000010  e8 46 01 00 00 00                                 |.F....|
 00000016

If you rename this first archive to a .whl file, it installs just fine.

Ergo, it seems like there is some sort of blank entry appended to the end of the .zip file.  *however* ... if you look at the end of a *good* wheel

                 v-- start here
 00015aa0  52 44 50 4b 05 06 00 00  00 00 3f 00 3f 00 d1 13  |RDPK......?.?...|
 00015ab0  00 00 d1 46 01 00 00 00                           |...F....|
 00015ab8

you also see a blank entry, though slightly different.  At this point, I dunno what all this means ...'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-10-22 05:42:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Actually, reading wikipedia, the "extra" bit in question seems to match up with a "End of central directory record (EOCD)"

  sig        dnum  dstrt disk   total   size      offset     comment
                           records                cent dir   length
    4          2     2     2      2      4          4          2
 ----------- ----- ----- ----- ----- ----------- ----------- -----
 50 4b 05 06 00 00 00 00 3f 00 3f 00 d1 13 00 00 e8 46 01 00 00 00    <- corrupt
 50 4b 05 06 00 00 00 00 3f 00 3f 00 d1 13 00 00 d1 46 01 00 00 00    <- good

so if something doesn't match up, it's the "offset of start of central directory, relative to start of archive".  maybe that's a clue...

[1] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zip_(file_format)#Central_directory_file_header'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-10-22 06:09:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-10-22 10:48:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-22 05:11:48.000000000', 'message': 'wheel-build : temporary pip with checksum output

We are currently trying to debug persistent wheel corruption.  So far,
we have been completely unable to replicate the corrupt output outside
the periodic jobs.

A first thought was that it was due to AFS corruption due to multiple
writes (I4f8a2f2c6c8164e7ea207f8e4b286e06df0b13dd), however this does
not appear to be the case.

Experimentally manually running the builds, on infra nodes, under
python2 and python3, in parallel just as done here, does not replicate
the problem.

This patched version of pip will output the sha256 hash for the final
build output of each wheel.  The plan is to correlate that against any
corrupt file that appears.  If the corrupt hash matches any file
produced by pip, then we know the problem is inside pip (and we will
have the exact build situation that it occured in); if the corrupt
file does not match then we must have some sort of issue copying the
files or similar.

Change-Id: I81943ed459bf4e2c77cae42e50af5fc5979682b4
'}]
commit_message:
wheel-build : temporary pip with checksum output

We are currently trying to debug persistent wheel corruption.  So far,
we have been completely unable to replicate the corrupt output outside
the periodic jobs.

A first thought was that it was due to AFS corruption due to multiple
writes (I4f8a2f2c6c8164e7ea207f8e4b286e06df0b13dd), however this does
not appear to be the case.

Experimentally manually running the builds, on infra nodes, under
python2 and python3, in parallel just as done here, does not replicate
the problem.

This patched version of pip will output the sha256 hash for the final
build output of each wheel.  The plan is to correlate that against any
corrupt file that appears.  If the corrupt hash matches any file
produced by pip, then we know the problem is inside pip (and we will
have the exact build situation that it occured in); if the corrupt
file does not match then we must have some sort of issue copying the
files or similar.

[{'created': '2018-10-16 08:37:37.000000000', 'message': 'Use limit -1 for nova servers list

By default nova has a limit for returned items in a single response [1].
We should pass limit=-1 to get all items.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/rocky/configuration/config.html

Change-Id: I1fabd909c4c0356ef5fcb7c51718fb4513e6befa
'}]
commit_message:
Use limit -1 for nova servers list

By default nova has a limit for returned items in a single response [1].
We should pass limit=-1 to get all items.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/rocky/configuration/config.html

Change-Id: I1fabd909c4c0356ef5fcb7c51718fb4513e6befa

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-19 10:32:47.000000000', 'message': "[Ocata/Pike] Pass DeployIdentifier in upgrade tasks.

The UpdateIdentifier timestamp does not get updated when
running the overcloud deploy command, which is the one used
for upgrading. As a consequence, if the upgrade_tasks managed
to run once they won't be executed again by heat when re-issueing
the upgrade command, as heat considers that the resource did
not change. For this reason, we need to pass DeployIdentifier
which will contain a different timestamp in each execution and
will allow the upgrade_tasks to be executed in the overcloud nodes.

(cherry picked from commit 1a0d1de712e7a1f855ce363b1226d53d0a54b152)
Change-Id: I49cecd8c793519185096fd99713521961022aec9
Closes-Bug: #1795790
Resolves: rhbz#1634034
"}, {'created': '2018-10-19 10:49:53.000000000', 'message': "[Ocata/Pike] Pass DeployIdentifier in upgrade tasks.

running the overcloud deploy command, which is the one used
for upgrading. As a consequence, if the upgrade_tasks managed
to run once they won't be executed again by heat when re-issueing
the upgrade command, as heat considers that the resource did
not change. For this reason, we need to pass DeployIdentifier
which will contain a different timestamp in each execution and
will allow the upgrade_tasks to be executed in the overcloud nodes.

(cherry picked from commit 1a0d1de712e7a1f855ce363b1226d53d0a54b152)

"}]
commit_message:
[Ocata/Pike] Pass DeployIdentifier in upgrade tasks.

The UpdateIdentifier timestamp does not get updated when
running the overcloud deploy command, which is the one used
for upgrading. As a consequence, if the upgrade_tasks managed
to run once they won't be executed again by heat when re-issueing
the upgrade command, as heat considers that the resource did
not change. For this reason, we need to pass DeployIdentifier
which will contain a different timestamp in each execution and
will allow the upgrade_tasks to be executed in the overcloud nodes.

(cherry picked from commit 1a0d1de712e7a1f855ce363b1226d53d0a54b152)
Change-Id: I49cecd8c793519185096fd99713521961022aec9
Closes-Bug: #1795790
Resolves: rhbz#1640982

commit_message:
Use Timesync service instead of Ntp

At the moment the 'OS::TripleO::Services::Timesync' service is
synonymous to 'OS::TripleO::Services::Ntp'. Let's use the more generic
Timesync service to pick up the new default in the event the value for
'OS::TripleO::Services::Timesync' changes.

This better aligns with the rest of the roles.

Change-Id: I44f706ce7dd1909ffd3805337fc6d9a5ce6de80f

commit_message:
Add OS::TripleO::Services::Rhsm to OpenShift roles

The OpenShift roles should include the OS::TripleO::Services::Rhsm
service for Red Hat Subscription Management so that the provisioned
nodes can register with a Satellite or CDN.

Add the Podman service to OpenShifAllInOne to be more consistent with
other roles.

Change-Id: I08862635c68eddbb0940863c43867ece1b289ee5

I'm still not buying the arguments. I'd like to hear from Neutron folks on whether network separation actually "does not scale". And with IPA running non-authenticated, there's too many opportunities to break stuff, that I only believe in network separation as a means of securing it.

On a bright side, I think you can start working on dropping look up even without this spec. This is something pretty straightforward. Then we can continue arguing about heartbeats (which is unlikely to land in Liberty IMO due to Futurist work dependency).'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2015-08-19 14:19:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

Hi James,

Thanks for the spec. Left some comments inline'}, {'account_id': 9452, 'date': '2015-08-19 17:08:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

(9 comments)

replies inline, my explanation of the communication between conductor and target is unclear, i'll put up another patch with that fix

Also, conceptually I prefer that heartbeats could exist. Polling every single host in the boot process is not efficient, and will cause problems when booting 1K+ hosts at once. Polling 1K+ hosts periodically to get their status is going to suck.

Perhaps there could be a heartbeat service on that intermediary ipxe host that I called out in the spec? The target node sends heartbeats up to that. Then, ironic conductor can make a single call to that and get a list of all heartbeats.

It would add scale, but at the cost of some complexity. Might be a good next step after this."}, {'account_id': 9452, 'date': '2015-08-19 17:50:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 9452, 'date': '2015-08-19 17:55:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-08-19 18:07:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Verified+1

(7 comments)

I like this idea, some comments inline. My biggest concerns are around scaling conductors up to handle this much more parallel work.

I would also like to explicitly note that while this is useful; it shouldn't be considered a replacement for network switching as needed."}, {'account_id': 10342, 'date': '2015-10-01 18:13:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

What I mean by my previous comment is deployers should have a choice: IPA communication with api/cond or not, as well as switching networks or not -- I don't see the two features as mutually exclusive as the spec implies."}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2015-10-08 20:25:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Code-Review-1

If it gets really bad and so much polling is happening that things start to fall over, we can look into doing this differently (perhaps by having IPA post messages into some message queue and having conductor be able to read from that queue, and then hardening that queue, and making sure that queue has write throttling and such to ensure attackers can't overload it)."}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2015-10-23 08:57:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Some questions/thoughts inline, but nothing overly show stopping. Good progress, and thanks!'}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2015-10-23 21:15:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 2889, 'date': '2015-10-26 04:41:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

When "poll_only" is enabled, why does the Node even need to know its UUID?

As long as the conductor knows the IP address and has a means to connect *to* the Node and drive the processes forward (whether via the agent's REST API or, as in another spec, via SSH and ansible scripts) -- why does the node need to know any identifiable information about itself? This spec is assuming that we need IPA to know the node UUID, but I don't understand why.

Aside from that, I also left a few comments inline.'}, {'account_id': 9452, 'date': '2015-10-30 02:17:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

Hi,

We recently reorganized the ironic-specs repository and now have a specs/not-implemented directory. After rebasing, please add a soft link there (via 'ln -s ../approved/<your-file>', 'git add <your-file>') so that your spec will show up at http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/ironic-specs/#approved-specifications. Sorry for the inconvenience."}, {'account_id': 10342, 'date': '2016-08-08 18:03:33.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Hi,

Thanks for contributing a specification to Ironic. However, because it hasn't been updated in 6 months or longer, I'm abandoning it. This is merely an administrative action to keep it out of the review queue since it is stale. If you'd still like to see this specification implemented in Ironic, please develop a new version of it addressing any negative feedback and updated with all new sections required to pass tests, then restore the patch and push the updated version to Gerrit.

Thanks,
Jay Faulkner"}, {'account_id': 6637, 'date': '2017-12-18 15:56:18.000000000', 'content': 'Restored'}, {'account_id': 10343, 'date': '2017-12-18 15:58:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 10343, 'date': '2017-12-18 16:00:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

Allowing a target node to contact the Ironic API as part of the boot
process, carries the implication that an attacker could then launch an

the target node for completed build state. Thus all network traffic
egresses from conductor to IPA, and never the other way around

commit_message:
No IPA to conductor communication

Allowing a target node to contact the Ironic API as part of the boot
process carries the implication that an attacker could then launch an
attack on the control plane via the Ironic API.

In this spec we provide a means to push the node ID to a target node,
and poll the target node for completed build state. Thus all network
traffic egresses from conductor to IPA, and never the other way around

Story: 1526486
Task: 10377
Co-Authored-By: Mario Villaplana <mario.villaplana@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Josh Gachnang <josh@pcsforeducation.com>
Co-Authored-By: Jim Rollenhagen <jim@jimrollenhagen.com>
Change-Id: Ief9fb2ecdf8dd7c071328ca73baad87ff711f22f

commit_message:
[DNM]Test experimental Zuul jobs

After this patch [1] has been merged for a while, it seems that all the
experimental Zuul jobs fail completely. This patch is to check these
jobs and try to fix them with other patches in the future.

[1].https://review.openstack.org/#/c/533137/

Change-Id: Ie2174dafbd579317924a2e071a0bc997ac367544
Signed-off-by: Fan Zhang <zh.f@outlook.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-21 15:01:31.000000000', 'message': "Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: Ie4d4b59ec6cf383875613b2fce6a7db0fdeab1db
"}]
commit_message:
Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: Ie4d4b59ec6cf383875613b2fce6a7db0fdeab1db

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-19 11:39:33.000000000', 'message': "Preserve compute stats used by the scheduler

The HostState object which is used by the scheduler is using the 'stats'
property of the compute node to derive its own values. These values are
used for both filtering and weighing compute hosts. However, the 'stats'
property of the compute node is cleared in RT._copy_resources() and then
populated again as part of update_available_resources(). This creates a
race condition between RT and scheduler which may result into populating
wrong values for 'num_io_ops' and 'num_instances' into the HostState object
and thus leading to incorrect scheduling decisions.

This patch fixes this by preserving all stats which are used by the
scheduler.

Change-Id: Ie36adc33ffdb1a7fc3a5c0a47ad618c4862c2ab9
Closes-Bug: #1798806
"}]
commit_message:
Preserve compute stats used by the scheduler

The HostState object which is used by the scheduler is using the 'stats'
property of the compute node to derive its own values. These values are
used for both filtering and weighing compute hosts. However, the 'stats'
property of the compute node is cleared in RT._copy_resources() and then
populated again as part of update_available_resources(). This creates a
race condition between RT and scheduler which may result into populating
wrong values for 'num_io_ops' and 'num_instances' into the HostState object
and thus leading to incorrect scheduling decisions.

This patch fixes this by preserving all stats which are used by the
scheduler.

Change-Id: Ie36adc33ffdb1a7fc3a5c0a47ad618c4862c2ab9
Closes-Bug: #1798806

Functional test nova.tests.functional.compute.test_resource_tracker.IronicResourceTrackerTest is not passing because it of this assert:

I think it is problem with the test_ironic_ocata_to_pike test case. The test wants to cover that a compute is changed to Pike version [1]  and therefore reporting CUSTOM ironic resources. I think this can only happen in reality if that compute service is restarted. The test does not simulate the full restart of the service just call into the resource_tracker to simulate some part of the service restart. I think this interferes with the old_resources field checked by the _resource_change() call. Properly restarting a compute service in the functional env is not trivial, see the proposed patch [2]

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/b6a245f0425a07be3871a976952646d2bdd44533/nova/tests/functional/compute/test_resource_tracker.py#L316

OK, this test does not even use a real compute service. So the [2] is not the way to restart such service. Somehow we have to reinitialize the resource tracker to simulate the compute restart. Simply re-instantiating it did not helped but at least I got a different error message. Below is what I tried:

diff --git a/nova/tests/functional/compute/test_resource_tracker.py b/nova/tests/functional/compute/test_resource_tracker.py

             # will be for VCPU, MEMORY_MB, DISK_GB, and also a new record for
             # the custom resource class of the Ironic node.
 
-

             self.driver_mock.get_available_resource.return_value = {
                 'hypervisor_hostname': cn1_obj.hypervisor_hostname,"}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2017-12-01 22:50:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 11583, 'date': '2017-12-11 11:27:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Cheers,
gibi'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2017-12-15 18:20:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

I'm having a hard time reasoning about the content of this change. The bug report is pretty clear that it is instances that are in SHUTDOWN state that cause the vcpus_used field value to be wrong for some period of time.

Why isn't the vcpus_used field value taking into account instances that are SHUTDOWN? Those instances are still consuming resources on the host and should be accounted for accordingly. Only instances that are terminated or shelve_offloaded should be removed from consideration of resource allocation, right?

So, my question is, why isn't the fix for this issue to ensure that instances in SHUTDOWN state are appropriately considered as consuming resources from the host?

-jay"}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2017-12-16 02:22:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Build succeeded.

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/520024/6/ : SUCCESS in 2h 47m 57s'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2017-12-18 14:36:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(4 comments)

> I'm having a hard time reasoning about the content of this change.
 > The bug report is pretty clear that it is instances that are in
 > SHUTDOWN state that cause the vcpus_used field value to be wrong
 > for some period of time.
 > 
 > Why isn't the vcpus_used field value taking into account instances
 > that are SHUTDOWN? Those instances are still consuming resources on
 > the host and should be accounted for accordingly. Only instances
 > that are terminated or shelve_offloaded should be removed from
 > consideration of resource allocation, right?
 > 
 > So, my question is, why isn't the fix for this issue to ensure that
 > instances in SHUTDOWN state are appropriately considered as
 > consuming resources from the host?
 > 
 > -jay

Thanks Matt, Gibi and Jay for your comments! :)

According to Jay comment. The Bug is about inconsistency in vpus_used field, but in fact its about inconsistency in general. Other fields like memory, disk etc. are also "fake" for a while in DB.

The problem is more complex. It's not only related to SHUTDOWN instances. As per code says it impacts also instances in resize/migration state (https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/62158f4a1220f51617501e869d41c5e77b76e693/nova/compute/resource_tracker.py#L723).

Perhaps I was not clear in bug report. I could change it to notice that its not only about vcpu_used and it also impact migrations. 

My idea behind fixing #1729621 is to cover all of those issues, because the root cause is the same. The root cause is that we update DB with different resources that its in real (during initialization of Node object) and just after that we update it again with proper values. My goal is to not do those operations twice.'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2017-12-19 14:08:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2017-12-19 16:22:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Maciej, I apologize, but I don't see how this patch fixes the bug in question (or even that we've identified the source of the bug). I would need to see a real test that demonstrates the order of code execution that triggers the bug condition. The additional mock_update.assert_called_once() calls in the unit tests are not sufficient for me."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2017-12-19 16:34:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2

OK, so after talking with Matt, I think I'm starting to see how this is fixing things... it's highly likely that the original _update() implementation never actually called compute_node.save() -- either that, or the _resource_change() routine has changed -- and that we are now saving the compute node state more often than we were previously.

I'm not entirely sure it would be possible to construct a readable unit test of this scenario, either, so I won't hold you to that. Alright, I've switched my vote... :)

-jay"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-12-19 16:40:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

I think we're OK with the overall direction, but need to address my comments from PS6, at least with the commit message and _check_for_nodes_rebalance."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2017-12-19 16:47:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2017-12-22 09:29:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2017-12-22 09:33:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2017-12-22 09:37:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2017-12-22 10:22:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-11366 : SUCCESS in 45m 05s'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2017-12-22 13:12:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Workflow-1

I found that after this change each time Placement gets notified it fails to update inventory - raising exception:

InvalidInventoryCapacity: Invalid inventory for 'VCPU' on resource provider '52559824-5fb1-424b-a4cf-79da9199447d'. The reserved value is greater than or equal to total.

The exception is raised here:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/objects/resource_provider.py#L228

We need to investigate more."}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2017-12-22 13:28:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2017-12-23 07:35:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with check hyper-v

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com//nova/520024/8/ : FAILURE in 3h 41m 29s'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-01-10 16:18:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

The placement PUT inventories API doesn't require a minimum value for allocation_ratio:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/api/openstack/placement/schemas/inventory.py#L53

But the capacity calculation includes it:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/objects/resource_provider.py#L1612

So that's going to always be 0 by default because when the driver.get_inventory() in the RT doesn't return any allocations, the payload is updated in the RT here:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/compute/resource_tracker.py#L83

And sets the allocation ratio values for vcpu/disk/memory but those config options all default to 0.0.

So we're always sending a 0.0 allocation_ratio by default for our update inventory call which is going to fail the capacity check on the placement side."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-01-10 16:39:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

This is what sets the "defaults" for allocation_ratio on the compute node object if they aren't set in the config:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/objects/compute_node.py#L198

So something must have changed in this patch such that it's not pulling the allocation_ratio values from the compute node at the right time, i.e. after the compute node has been created.'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2018-01-11 08:09:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Matt,

Exact cause of the problem is here, in _copy_resources()
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/compute/resource_tracker.py#L604

We use this function each time while initializing ComputeNode object.
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/compute/resource_tracker.py#L539

So.. As you see in L558
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/compute/resource_tracker.py#L558

CN object has defined ratios, bigger than 0 (because of https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/objects/compute_node.py#L198)

But just after that we call _copy_resoures() that cleans this settings and sets "self.cpu_allocation_ratio" (and others for ram and disk), which is in my case - 0.

Code:
> /opt/stack/nova/nova/compute/resource_tracker.py(606)

 602         def _copy_resources(self, compute_node, resources):                                                                                                                                                                             
 603             """Copy resource values to supplied compute_node."""                                                                                                                                                                        
 604             # purge old stats and init with anything passed in by the driver                                                                                                                                                            
 605             self.stats.clear()                                                                                                                                                                                                          
 606  ->         self.stats.digest_stats(resources.get('stats'))                                                                                                                                                                             
 607             compute_node.stats = copy.deepcopy(self.stats)                                                                                                                                                                              
 608                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         
 609             # update the allocation ratios for the related ComputeNode object                                                                                                                                                           
 610             compute_node.ram_allocation_ratio = self.ram_allocation_ratio                                                                                                                                                               
 611             compute_node.cpu_allocation_ratio = self.cpu_allocation_ratio                                                                                                                                                               
 612             compute_node.disk_allocation_ratio = self.disk_allocation_ratio                                                                                                                                                             
 613                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         
 614             # now copy rest to compute_node                                                                                                                                                                                             
 615             compute_node.update_from_virt_driver(resources)                                                                                                                                                                             
(Pdb++) self.cpu_allocation_ratio
0.0
(Pdb++)

So basically we should L611-614 from https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/compute/resource_tracker.py? Other Patch?

Without this (for now) it overrides default values all the time, to values from the config.'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2018-01-11 08:55:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

But from the other hand - what if operator changes the config parameters? We need to update that...

I not fluent in this, but IMO we need to define default ratio as 1?'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-01-29 23:09:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Note a similar change proposed:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/529236/'}, {'account_id': 22560, 'date': '2018-02-01 02:15:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2018-02-01 08:04:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Working on: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/532924/
Then it could be merged (safely).'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2018-02-26 22:27:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2018-02-27 20:46:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

Ok, so a little update about this patch.

1) Because of 0.0 allocation ratios in devstack config we're not able to send RT updates to placement, it could be solved in 2 ways: propose default non-zero values for allocation ratios (what I personally want to do - see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/532924/) or second - reconfigure devstack to use non-default (so for now non-zero) ratios.

2) Second thing after fixing 1 is to check if db updates are really working properly. I think not because of line: https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/compute/resource_tracker.py#L854
that check everytime if some resource was changed and in this terms the db is being updated. Sice we remove double db updates with this patch the only way to update the DB is to wait for some resource change.
So I think that check from line L854 should be removed after we apply this patch."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-08-06 15:51:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Patch Set 8 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-08-06 15:51:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

commit_message:
Update resources once in update_available_resource

This change ensures that resources are updated only once per
update_available_resource() call.

Compute resources were previously updated during host
object initialization and at the end of
update_available_resource(). It could cause inconsistencies
in resource tracking between compute host and DB for couple
of second when final _update() at the end of
update_available_resource() is being called.

For example: nova-api shows that host uses 10GB of RAM, but
in fact its 12GB because DB doesn't have resources that belongs
to shutdown instance.

Because of that fact nova-scheduler (CachingScheduler) could
choose (based on imcomplete information) host which is already full.

For more informations please see realted bug: #1729621

Change-Id: I120a98cc4c11772f24099081ef3ac44a50daf71d
Closes-Bug: #1729621

The flow of events:

commit_message:
Healthmanager shouldn't update NO_MONITOR members

During a create of a member on a pool with no healthmonitor, there is a
chance the member will be briefly updated to OFFLINE incorrectly.

The flow of events:
1. A Member is created in DB in NO_MONITOR.
2. A Member is passed to the handler.
3. A health message comes in, not including the member.
4. The Member is present in the DB but missing from the Amp, and is
   set to OFFLINE status.
5. The Member is created on the amp.
6. Another health messages comes in, and the Member is put back in the
   correct NO_MONITOR state.

Change-Id: I74c8cda0c7da88fedf652215630c701bb2761eef

subject: Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini
messages: [{'account_id': 17130, 'date': '2018-10-21 14:48:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2018-10-22 06:49:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-21 14:48:21.000000000', 'message': "Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: I068ac92a340a5a31af53f77b69a702c5c138b4c8
"}]
commit_message:
Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: I068ac92a340a5a31af53f77b69a702c5c138b4c8

commit_message:
Fix help message of user_unique_last_password_count

If we want to use identity.user_unique_last_password_count, we must
firstly set identity-feature-enabled.security_compliance to True,
whose default value is False.
So this is to fix the help message of user_unique_last_password_count
to mention this.

Change-Id: I0979c468b67957309a5c877f084eaf4c47007e6d

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one

commit_message:
Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: I123b7167bacca583d26a8f796554904ad15f1535

Looking at the Rocky upgrade release notes, here is maybe a candidate for a pre-upgrade check:

"Backup service to driver mapping is removed. If you use old values like ‘cinder.backup.services.swift’ or ‘cinder.backup.services.ceph’ it should be changed to ‘cinder.backup.drivers.swift’ or ‘cinder.backup.drivers.ceph’ accordingly to get your backup service working."

If that is already controlled via deprecated configuration option aliases, maybe it's less interesting for a pre-upgrade check since I tend to think of pre-upgrade checks as things that look into the database rather than just verify config.'}, {'account_id': 26537, 'date': '2018-10-15 15:05:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Base framework for cinder-status upgrade check

This adds the cinder-status CLI for performing upgrade checks as part of
the Stein cycle upgrade-checkers goal. It only includes a placeholder
for actual checks. Follow up patches will need to be added for anything
we identify as needing specific checking.

Story: 2003657
Task: 26123
Change-Id: I2e532d313d12e60848b17e869882e52ec456929b
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Use different base virtual_router_id on openshift

With the default setting, the keepalived that we deploy on the master
node collides with the one that is setup on the undercloud. We simply
need to use a different virtual_router_id_base to prevent
virtual_router_id collision.

Change-Id: I92ef081a111f93ddce4ec42400bcb648b7f7def0

commit_message:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-21 12:18:05.000000000', 'message': 'make user_info_endpoint_url independent of auth_url

Client should be able to create a token using “auth_url” (e.g. ”https://keycloak:7443/auth”)
Server should be able to validate the token using “user_info_endpoint_url” (e.g. “https://cbnd:9443/something/custom”)
also be backward compatible

(cherry picked from commit ae23de737dae96fb73e148d496214a5a09dcc2a0)

Change-Id: I7561f00d4239567a258c1eb0a610be62d9dc90ce
'}]
commit_message:
make user_info_endpoint_url independent of auth_url

Client should be able to create a token using “auth_url” (e.g. ”https://keycloak:7443/auth”)
Server should be able to validate the token using “user_info_endpoint_url” (e.g. “https://cbnd:9443/something/custom”)
also be backward compatible

(cherry picked from commit ae23de737dae96fb73e148d496214a5a09dcc2a0)

Change-Id: I7561f00d4239567a258c1eb0a610be62d9dc90ce

commit_message:
Add framework for blazar-status upgrade check

This commit adds the functionality of blazar-status CLI for performing
upgrade checks as part of the Stein cycle upgrade-checkers goal.
It only includes a sample check which must be replaced by real checks in
future.

Change-Id: I65bc1702f11ef46c3949124d2e56dea974f3d863
Story: 2003657
Task: 26121

commit_message:
Clear all l3 related namespace before starting neutron-l3-agent only when l3_ha is enable

If we are not using l3 ha mode, it’s not necessary to delete the namespaces related to l3. It will speed up the start of the neutron l3 agent.

Change-Id: I78f6d927a78e8f9e4ed855e4b6d1362bdfc6b985
Closes-Bug: #1785880
(cherry picked from commit 353230a17e91f65977706944202f52c8da4fe827)

[{'created': '2018-06-05 06:47:42.000000000', 'message': 'AppArmor profile improvements for Fibre Channel

Add various AppArmor rules required to support FibreChannel disk
attachments, specifically tested against the HP 3Par driver but should
work generically.

/dev/sd* is required as nova code checks if the device is readable
(os-brick/os_brick/initiator/connectors/base.py:check_valid_device)

Change-Id: I943fa27e033884d9ab88a510424debc15e27c207
'}]
commit_message:
AppArmor profile improvements for Fibre Channel

Add various AppArmor rules required to support FibreChannel disk
attachments, specifically tested against the HP 3Par driver but should
work generically.

/dev/sd* is required as nova code checks if the device is readable
(os-brick/os_brick/initiator/connectors/base.py:check_valid_device)

Change-Id: I943fa27e033884d9ab88a510424debc15e27c207

messages: [{'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-09-29 23:49:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-10-03 21:10:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 25553, 'date': '2018-10-04 08:25:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-10-22 03:26:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-29 23:49:24.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I51fb01c0ae18ba2c249646d1197922a3f9297f7a
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-10-03 21:10:40.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I51fb01c0ae18ba2c249646d1197922a3f9297f7a
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I51fb01c0ae18ba2c249646d1197922a3f9297f7a
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
comment out stein section of toctree

There are no stein specs, so using a glob pattern to include them in the
output causes a warning which then breaks the build. Comment that
toctree out for now.

Change-Id: I97ca5dae30e59023256e6368aa98953f7cb157dd
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Increment versioning with pbr instruction
messages: [{'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-10-15 13:48:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25553, 'date': '2018-10-16 04:58:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-10-22 03:24:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-15 13:48:20.000000000', 'message': 'Increment versioning with pbr instruction

With moving away from required milestone releases, the version numbers
calculated by PBR on the master branch will not work for those testing
upgrades from the last stable release. More details can be found in the
mailing list post here:

    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135706.html

This is an empty commit that will cause PBR to increment its calculated
version to get around this.

PBR will see the following which will cause it to increment the version:

Sem-Ver: feature

Please merge this patch as soon as possible to support those testing
upgrades.

Change-Id: I2190313c77f69c3cabc6e60c2e18762ccebdc7cc
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Increment versioning with pbr instruction

With moving away from required milestone releases, the version numbers
calculated by PBR on the master branch will not work for those testing
upgrades from the last stable release. More details can be found in the
mailing list post here:

    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135706.html

This is an empty commit that will cause PBR to increment its calculated
version to get around this.

PBR will see the following which will cause it to increment the version:

Sem-Ver: feature

Please merge this patch as soon as possible to support those testing
upgrades.

Change-Id: I2190313c77f69c3cabc6e60c2e18762ccebdc7cc
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Convert Normalizing filter to flask native Middleware

Normalizing filter has been converted to a flask-native style
middleware instead of leaning on the old application logic from
Webob. We also now strip all trailing slashes, not just a single
traling slash.

Test Changes:

* test_url_middleware now tests the new middleware directly instead
  of leaning on webob and fake requests.

Change-Id: I5f82817b61a9284b97cf6443105107150d4a1757
Partial-Bug: #1776504

commit_message:
Support patch rows to datasources

Example:

$ openstack congress datasource row patch <datasource id/name> \
       <table id> <patch operations string>
$ openstack congress datasource row patch push table0 '
[{"op":"add", "value":{"col1": "val1", "col2": "val2"}}]'

Change-Id: I89744b86e13df945430cb3c8bb0af9d69d16cace

commit_message:
Add WSGI support script for cyborg API

Control Plane API endpoints deployment via WSGI [1] was a community goal
in Pike release. This method provides a series of advantages over that
of running api via a Python command that runs a web server.

This patch add scripts for running API services via WSGI.
The follow-up patch will add the devstack install support.

[1]https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/pike/deploy-api-in-wsgi.html

Change-Id: Ifb0ae2fa2143236fb9b38d230f2604e4e560e66e

subject: Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-10 02:46:24.000000000', 'message': "Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: I24d6d5ddbe337a3de68ec7de8564adf2bfecdd6f
"}]
commit_message:
Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: I24d6d5ddbe337a3de68ec7de8564adf2bfecdd6f

commit_message:
Set default paths for OpenStack

Several previous openstackdocstheme deployments
used get_pdf_theme_path() and get_openstack_logo_path()
without arguments. This patch adds default arguments as 'openstack'
to correctly work on such deployments.

Change-Id: I23a5ae26b3367514a8e531925f93ddc97d56f6be

messages:
[{'account_id': 29043, 'date': '2018-10-19 06:03:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-10-19 06:03:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

'}, {'created': '2018-10-19 06:20:11.000000000', 'message': 'Bug fix: add missing fields required when adding deployables

Fix the broken database insertion code for deployables & accelerators
tables which is not compatible with new scheme anymore.

- add `interface_type` missing in Intel FPGA driver
- insert device records into `accelerators` table 
- pass the ids of accelerators into `deployables` as `accelerator_id` 

Change-Id: If3e563f2532247eee267d1aab011899b5806c5f1
'}]
commit_message:
Bug fix: add missing fields required when adding deployables

Fix the broken database insertion code for deployables & accelerators
tables which is not compatible with new scheme anymore.

- add `interface_type` missing in Intel FPGA driver
- insert device records into `accelerators` table 
- pass the ids of accelerators into `deployables` as `accelerator_id` 

Change-Id: If3e563f2532247eee267d1aab011899b5806c5f1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-29 02:53:10.000000000', 'message': 'Pass in `region_name` to get correct heat endpoint

In a multi regions openstack cloud, when user create a cluster in the
one region, heat-container-agent may try to get stack data from the
other regions and will definitely fail because currently
heat-container-agent doesn't pass "region_name" when searching for
Heat endpoints. This patch fixes the issue by passing the region
name.

Task: 22627
Story: 2002768

Change-Id: I88016482e887ce0b0fa309199abd27cf0e777e2c

commit_message:
Pass in `region_name` to get correct heat endpoint

In a multi regions openstack cloud, when user create a cluster in the
one region, heat-container-agent may try to get stack data from the
other regions and will definitely fail because currently
heat-container-agent doesn't pass "region_name" when searching for
Heat endpoints. This patch fixes the issue by passing the region
name.

Please refer the fix Iec6f3606c9fdf8474f393b0990356f34d38bcf75 on
Heat side.

Task: 22627
Story: 2002768

Change-Id: I88016482e887ce0b0fa309199abd27cf0e777e2c

commit_message:
Disable devstack gate tempest in zunclient job

The job is for testing OSC so we don't need to run tempest job.

Change-Id: Ideba945ea6cf888b06c182717e77cb1fd040541f

commit_message:
Invalidate app cred AFTER deletion

Invalidate the application credential after deletion, not before.
This prevents timing issues where an app_cred could remain active
after deletion.

Change-Id: I14748bf2399e5da4ee360f451a8050f25dd90803

commit_message:
Add framework for zun-status upgrade check

This commit adds the functionality of zun-status CLI for performing
upgrade checks as part of the Stein cycle upgrade-checkers goal.
It only includes a sample check which must be replaced by real checks in
future.

Change-Id: I952bfe49fefb007b8f3d3e05b049527f401f26e9
Story: 2003657
Task: 26166

commit_message:
Add support for cinder backend availability zones

Add the ability to override the "backend_availability_zone" parameter
in every cinder volume backend.

Implements: blueprint split-controlplane-cinder-volume-az
Depends-On: I11821a38d8ba5afc594b3d601cd1634207a6f093
Change-Id: Ic407b747474b567858ad36beabc8a7d8c5022343
